47 template<typename real_type, typename int_type, typename point_type>
48 struct active_edge_rec;
49 
50 template<typename real_type, bool isFloatingPoint>
51 struct PrecisionGuardianHelper
52 {
53  static void SetDeltaYInverseAndBitShiftBasedOnHeight( real_type& deltaYInverse,
54  int& /*shift*/,
55  real_type height )
56  {
57  real_type one(1);
58  deltaYInverse = real_services::DivWillOverflow( one, height ) ? 0 : one / height;
59  }
60 
61  static void InFixedPointBuildsShiftAsNecessary( real_type& /*possibly_shifted_t_value*/, int /*shift*/ )
62  {
63  // do nothing in floating point builds
64  }
65 };
66 
67 template<typename real_type>
68 struct PrecisionGuardianHelper<real_type, false>
69 {
70  static void SetDeltaYInverseAndBitShiftBasedOnHeight( real_type& deltaYInverse, int& shift, real_type height )
71  {
72  tetraphilia_assert( height > 0 );
73  tetraphilia_assert( real_services::RealTypeHelper<real_type>::numIntegerBits >= 4 );
74  real_type one(1);
75  if ( height < one ) {
76  // would be better here if we chose shift based on the log most significant bit position of 'height', but for now we won't because this is not an entirely trivial value to compute.
77  //shift = real_services::RealTypeHelper<real_type>::numIntegerBits - 1 + Exponent<real_type>( height ); // Exponent will be negative here so this shrinks 'shift'
78  //if ( shift < 0 )
79  // shift = 0;
80  shift = 0;
81  }
82  else
83  shift = real_services::RealTypeHelper<real_type>::numIntegerBits - 1;
84 
85  deltaYInverse = real_services::MultByPowerOf2( one, shift ) / height;
86  }
87 
88  static void InFixedPointBuildsShiftAsNecessary( real_type& possibly_shifted_t_value, int shift )
89  {
90  possibly_shifted_t_value = real_services::DivideByPowerOf2( possibly_shifted_t_value, shift );
91  }
92 };
93 
94 template<typename real_type>
95 struct PrecisionGuardian
96 {
97  static void SetDeltaYInverseAndBitShiftBasedOnHeight( real_type& deltaYInverse, int& shift, real_type height )
98  {
99  PrecisionGuardianHelper<real_type, real_services::RealTypeHelper<real_type>::isFloatingPointType>::SetDeltaYInverseAndBitShiftBasedOnHeight( deltaYInverse, shift, height );
100  }
101 
102  static void InFixedPointBuildsShiftAsNecessary( real_type& possibly_shifted_t_value, int shift )
103  {
104  PrecisionGuardianHelper<real_type, real_services::RealTypeHelper<real_type>::isFloatingPointType>::InFixedPointBuildsShiftAsNecessary( possibly_shifted_t_value, shift );
105  }
106 };
107 
108 
109 template<typename real_type, bool isFloatingPoint>
110 struct DifferenceIsTooLargeForLinesHelper
111 {
112  static bool Check( real_type /*a*/, real_type /*b*/ )
113  {
114  // currently we don't restrict the dimensions of lines in floating point builds
115  return false;
116  }
117 };
118 
119 template<typename real_type>
120 struct DifferenceIsTooLargeForLinesHelper<real_type, false>
121 {
122  static bool Check( real_type a, real_type b )
123  {
124  // ensure b <= a
125  if ( b > a )
126  boost::swap( a, b );
127  // if smaller value is non-negative then the difference is representable
128  if ( b >= 0 )
129  return false;
130  // otherwise, the max() value can be added to b safely and we can compare that to a
131  return ( b + limits<real_type>::max() < a );
132  }
133 };
134 
135 template<typename real_type>
136 struct DifferenceIsTooLargeForLines
137 {
138  static bool Check( real_type a, real_type b )
139  {
140  return DifferenceIsTooLargeForLinesHelper<real_type, real_services::RealTypeHelper<real_type>::isFloatingPointType>::Check( a, b );
141  }
142 };
143 
144 
145 template<typename real_type, typename int_type, typename point_type>
146 struct edge_rec
147 {
149  // MEMBERS WHICH ARE INTRINSIC TO THE EDGE
150 
151  t4::brief_ptr<edge_rec> nextEdge;
152  t4::brief_ptr<edge_rec> belowEdge;
153 
154  real_type deltaX; // only used for lines
155  real_type deltaYInverse; // only used for lines
156  int deltaYInverseShift; // only used for lines (and only in fixed point builds)
157 
158 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
159  // coefficients of polynomial in quasi-power form: a t^3 + 3b t^2 + 3c t + d
160  real_type a_x;
161  real_type b_x;
162  real_type c_x;
163  real_type d_x;
164  real_type a_y;
165  real_type b_y;
166  real_type c_y;
167  real_type d_y;
168 #endif
169 
170  point_type bezier_points[NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT];
171  point_type& top() { return bezier_points[0]; }
172  point_type& ctop() { return bezier_points[1]; }
173  point_type& cbot() { return bezier_points[2]; }
174  point_type& bot() { return bezier_points[3]; }
175 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
176 // point_type& tvalForCurSplit() { return bezier_points[4]; } // never used directly but we need to make sure we allocate 5 points in this case
177 #endif
178 
179  cubic_bernstein_monotone_poly_storage<real_type> xCubicBernsteinPoly;
180  cubic_bernstein_monotone_poly_storage<real_type> yCubicBernsteinPoly;
181 
182  signed char windingNum; // 1 or -1
183  signed char deltaXSign; // 1 or 0 or -1
184  bool isFirstOfYMinPair;
185  bool isFirstOfYMaxPair;
186  bool isLine;
187  bool isFirstEdgeOfContour;
188 
189 #if defined(_DEBUG) && !(defined(__arm__) || defined(__SYMBIAN32__))
190  int id;
191  static int globalID;
192 #endif
193 
195  // MEMBERS USED ONLY WHEN THE EDGE IS ACTIVE
196 
197  // cachedEdgeToLeft[0] = edge to left when this edge is INSERTED into the active edges list
198  // cachedEdgeToLeft[1] = edge to left when this edge is REMOVED from the active edges list
199  // used when edge is going in/out of the active list
200  edge_rec* cachedEdgeToLeft[2];
201 
202  // activeData only valid when hasBeenActivated is true
203  bool hasBeenActivated;
204  active_edge_rec<real_type,int_type,point_type> *activeData;
205 
206  static int compareBandTops( const void* e1, const void* e2, void* unused );
207 
208  #if !defined(NDEBUG) && defined(_MSC_VER)
209  void OutputDebug(char* indent = NULL)
210  {
211  char nul = 0;
212  char buf[2048];
213 
214  if ( indent == NULL )
215  indent = &nul;
216 
217  if ( isLine )
218  sprintf( buf, "%sisLine=true index=%d top=(%f,%f) bot=(%f,%f) curXBandTop=%f curXBandBot=%f\n",
219  indent,
220  edgeSortsIndex,
221  get_x(top()), get_y(top()),
222  get_x(bot()), get_y(bot()),
223  activeData->curXBandTop, activeData->curXBandBot
224  );
225  else
226  sprintf( buf, "%sisLine=false isLocallyLine=%s index=%d top=(%f,%f) ctop=(%f,%f) cbot=(%f,%f) bot=(%f,%f) curXBandTop=%f curXBandBot=%f curTBandTop=%f curTBandBot=%f\n",
227  indent,
228  isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine ? "true" : "false",
229  edgeSortsIndex,
230  get_x(top()), get_y(top()),
231  get_x(ctop()), get_y(ctop()),
232  get_x(cbot()), get_y(cbot()),
233  get_x(bot()), get_y(bot()),
234  activeData->curXBandTop, activeData->curXBandBot,
235  activeData->curTBandTop, activeData->curTBandBot
236  );
237  OutputDebugString(buf);
238  }
239  #endif
240 };
241 
242 template<typename real_type, typename int_type, typename point_type>
243 struct active_edge_rec
244 {
245  static const size_t kSplitBezBuffSize = 16;
246  typedef std::array<point_type, kSplitBezBuffSize * NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT> split_buf_type; // NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT can be 5 because of 4 points and a fifth psuedo point
247 
248  static const size_t crossing_buf_type_size = forward_difference_limit<real_type>::kMaxSteps + 1; // do not change this without fully going through logic in bezier_utils as logic there assumes that this array size will be at least as large as kMaxSteps + 1
249 
250  typedef std::array<real_type, crossing_buf_type_size> crossing_buf_type;
251 
252  real_type curXBandTop;
253  real_type curXBandBot;
254 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
255  real_type curTBandTop; // curves only
256  real_type curTBandBot; // curves only
257 #endif
258  real_type curYLocalControlPointsTop; // curves only
259  real_type curYLocalControlPointsBot; // curvss only
260 
261 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
262  // used only to cache x and t values computed for a y value for this edge
263  real_type xVal;
264  real_type yVal;
265  real_type tVal;
266 #endif
267 
268 #ifdef USE_PRECOMPUTED_CURVATURE_DATA_1
269  real_type vxa[3]; // curves only
270  inline real_type VelocityCrossAcceleration( real_type t ) // curves only
271  {
272  tetraphilia_assert( !isLine );
273  return (vxa[0] * t + vxa[1]) * t + vxa[2];
274  }
275 #endif
276 
277  point_type localControlPoint[4]; // curves only
278 
279  crossing_buf_type* crossingXBufferPtr; // curves only
280  real_type* curXCross; // curves only
281 
282 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
283  real_type *crossingTBufferPtr; // curves only
284  real_type *curTCross; // curves only
285 #endif
286 
287  split_buf_type* slipBezBufferPtr; // curves only
288  point_type* curSplit; // curves only
289 
290  int_type crossingBuffTopY; // curves only
291  int_type crossingBuffBotY; // curves only
292 
293  int_type curWindingToRightOfEdge;
294 
295  int edgeSortsIndex;
296 
297 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
298  bool isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine;
299 #endif
300  bool firstCall;
301  bool isBarrier;
302 #ifdef SET_X_FROM_INTERSECTIONS
303  bool xSetFromIntersection;
304 #endif
305 };
306 
307 template<typename real_type, typename int_type, typename point_type>
308 int edge_rec<real_type, int_type, point_type>::compareBandTops( const void* e1, const void* e2, void* /*unused*/ )
309 {
310  real_type diff = (*static_cast<const edge_rec* const*>(e1))->activeData->curXBandTop - (*static_cast<const edge_rec* const*>(e2))->activeData->curXBandTop;
311  if ( diff < 0 )
312  return -1;
313  if ( diff > 0 )
314  return 1;
315  return 0;
316 }
317 
318 #if defined(_DEBUG) && !(defined(__arm__) || defined(__SYMBIAN32__))
319 template<typename real_type, typename int_type, typename point_type>
320 int edge_rec<real_type, int_type, point_type>::globalID;
321 #endif
322 
323 template<typename _real_type>
324 struct IntersectionData
325 {
326  _real_type x0PowerSeriesCoefficient[4];
327  _real_type y0PowerSeriesCoefficient[4];
328  _real_type x1PowerSeriesCoefficient[4];
329  _real_type y1PowerSeriesCoefficient[4];
330 };
331 
332 template<typename _real_type>
333 struct IntersectionParameters
334 {
335  _real_type t[2];
336  _real_type x;
337  _real_type y;
338  bool edge0SwitchingFromRightToLeft;
339 };
340 
341 template<typename _point_type>
342 struct BezierSegment
343 {
344  _point_type controlPoint[4];
345 };
346 
347 template<typename _real_type>
348 struct IntervalBezierSegment
349 {
350  IntervalBezierSegment() {}
351 
352  IntervalBezierSegment( _real_type x1, _real_type y1, _real_type t1, _real_type x2, _real_type y2, _real_type t2 )
353  : xtop(x1), ytop(y1), ttop(t1), xbot(x2), ybot(y2), tbot(t2)
354  {
355  }
356 
357  _real_type xtop;
358  _real_type ytop;
359  _real_type ttop;
360 
361  _real_type xbot;
362  _real_type ybot;
363  _real_type tbot;
364 };
365 
366 enum edge_change_kind {
367  k_insert,
368  k_remove,
369  k_replace,
370  k_terminator,
371  // intersection types
372  k_swap,
373  k_swapAtTopOfBand // special 'swap' type used to distinguish in which band an intersection at an insertion/deletion band boundary occured.
374 };
375 
376 template<typename _edge_type, typename _real_type, typename _edge_change_kind>
377 struct edge_insertion_deletion_change
378 {
379  _edge_type* m_edge[2];
380  _real_type m_yVal;
381  _edge_change_kind m_type;
382 
383  static int compareInsertionDeletionChanges( const void* e1, const void* e2, void* data );
384 };
385 
386 template<typename _edge_type, typename _real_type, typename _edge_change_kind>
387 struct edge_intersection_change
388 {
389  _edge_type* m_edge[2];
390  _real_type m_yVal;
391 #ifdef RECORD_INTERSECTION_X_VALUES
392  _real_type m_xVal;
393 #endif
394  _real_type m_t[2]; // for curves, the t value of the intersection for m_edge[0] and m_edge[1], respectively.
395  _edge_change_kind m_type;
396 
397  static bool compareIntersectionChanges( const edge_intersection_change& e1, const edge_intersection_change& e2 );
398 };
399 
400 template<typename _int_type>
401 struct ReducerSegmentData
402 {
403  typedef _int_type int_type;
404 
405  ReducerSegmentData( ReducerSegmentType index, _int_type segStop )
406  : m_segType( index ),
407  m_segStop( segStop )
408  {}
409 
410  ReducerSegmentData( void )
411  {
412  #ifdef _DEBUG
413  memset( &m_segType, 0xbb, sizeof( m_segType ) );
414  memset( &m_segStop, 0xbb, sizeof( m_segStop ) );
415  #endif
416  }
417 
418  ReducerSegmentType m_segType;
419  int_type m_segStop;
420  t4::brief_ptr<ReducerSegmentData> m_next;
421 };
422 
423 template<typename app_traits>
424 class bezier_sampler
425 {
426 public:
427  typedef typename app_traits::real_geometry_traits::coord_type real_type;
428  typedef typename app_traits::int_geometry_traits::coord_type int_type;
429  typedef typename app_traits::int_geometry_traits::rect_type int_rect_type;
430  typedef typename app_traits::real_geometry_traits::matrix_type matrix_type;
431  typedef typename app_traits::real_geometry_traits::point_type point_type;
432  typedef typename app_traits::context_type context_type;
433  typedef Constraints constraints_type;
434 
435  template<typename Rng>
436  bezier_sampler( Rng&& bez_segments,
437  const constraints_type& constraints,
438  const matrix_type& mat,
439  bool isEvenOddFill = false );
440 
441 #ifdef PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER
442  ~bezier_sampler()
443  {
444  float mhz = 1997000000.0f;
445  char buf[2048];
446  sprintf(buf,"%f: (%I64d ticks) Total Time\n%f: (%I64d ticks) time in ctor\n%f (%I64d ticks) time in NextScanLine\n%f (%I64d ticks) time PER NextScanLine\n%d num NextScanLine calls\n\n",
447  (m_time_spent_in_sampler_ctor + m_time_spent_in_NextScanLine) / mhz,
448  (m_time_spent_in_sampler_ctor + m_time_spent_in_NextScanLine),
449  m_time_spent_in_sampler_ctor / mhz,
450  m_time_spent_in_sampler_ctor,
451  m_time_spent_in_NextScanLine / mhz,
452  m_time_spent_in_NextScanLine,
453  (m_numTimesNextScanLineWasCalled ? m_time_spent_in_NextScanLine / m_numTimesNextScanLineWasCalled : 0) / mhz,
454  (m_numTimesNextScanLineWasCalled ? m_time_spent_in_NextScanLine / m_numTimesNextScanLineWasCalled : 0),
455  m_numTimesNextScanLineWasCalled
456  );
457  OutputDebugString(buf);
458 
459  #if PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER >= 2
460  sprintf(buf,"%f: checking for interections\n%f: time PER checking for intersection\n%d num intersection checks\n\n",
461  m_time_spent_in_intersection_checks / mhz,
462  (m_numCurveIntersectionChecks ? m_time_spent_in_intersection_checks / m_numCurveIntersectionChecks : 0) / mhz,
463  m_numCurveIntersectionChecks
464  );
465  OutputDebugString(buf);
466 
467  sprintf(buf,"%f: in InverseYOfBezierSegment()\n%f: time PER call to InverseYOfBezierSegment\n%d num InverseYOfBezierSegment calls\n\n",
468  m_time_spent_in_InverseYOfBezierSegment / mhz,
469  (m_numTimesInverseYOfBezierSegmentWasCalled ? m_time_spent_in_InverseYOfBezierSegment / m_numTimesInverseYOfBezierSegmentWasCalled : 0) / mhz,
470  m_numTimesInverseYOfBezierSegmentWasCalled
471  );
472  OutputDebugString(buf);
473 
474  sprintf(buf,"%f: in Inverse in getXAndTValuesForYValueWasCalled()\n%f: time PER call to Inverse in getXAndTValuesForYValueWasCalled\n%d num Inverse in getXAndTValuesForYValueWasCalled calls\n\n",
475  m_time_spent_in_Inverse_in_getXAndTValuesForYValue / mhz,
476  (m_numTimesInverse_in_getXAndTValuesForYValueWasCalled ? m_time_spent_in_Inverse_in_getXAndTValuesForYValue / m_numTimesInverse_in_getXAndTValuesForYValueWasCalled : 0) / mhz,
477  m_numTimesInverse_in_getXAndTValuesForYValueWasCalled
478  );
479  OutputDebugString(buf);
480 
481  sprintf(buf,"%f: in Inverse in xminClipped case\n%f: time PER call to Inverse in xminClipped case\n%d num Inverse in xminClipped case calls\n\n",
482  m_time_spent_in_Inverse_in_xminClipped_case / mhz,
483  (m_numTimesInverse_in_xminClipped_case ? m_time_spent_in_Inverse_in_xminClipped_case / m_numTimesInverse_in_xminClipped_case : 0) / mhz,
484  m_numTimesInverse_in_xminClipped_case
485  );
486  OutputDebugString(buf);
487 
488  sprintf(buf,"%d/%d = %f: getXAndTValues cache misses\n\n",
489  m_cacheMissesFor_getXAndTValuesForYValue,
490  m_callsTo_getXAndTValuesForYValue,
491  m_callsTo_getXAndTValuesForYValue ? real_type(m_cacheMissesFor_getXAndTValuesForYValue) / m_callsTo_getXAndTValuesForYValue : 0
492  );
493  OutputDebugString(buf);
494 
495  #endif
496  sprintf(buf,"%f: (%I64d ticks) probe1\n%f: (%I64d ticks) time PER call to probe1\n%d probe1 hits\n\n",
497  m_time_spent_in_probe1 / mhz,
498  m_time_spent_in_probe1,
499  (m_num_probe1 ? m_time_spent_in_probe1 / m_num_probe1 : 0) / mhz,
500  (m_num_probe1 ? m_time_spent_in_probe1 / m_num_probe1 : 0),
501  m_num_probe1
502  );
503  OutputDebugString(buf);
504 
505  sprintf(buf,"%f: (%I64d ticks) probe2\n%f: (%I64d ticks) time PER call to probe2\n%d probe2 hits\n\n",
506  m_time_spent_in_probe2 / mhz,
507  m_time_spent_in_probe2,
508  (m_num_probe2 ? m_time_spent_in_probe2 / m_num_probe2 : 0) / mhz,
509  (m_num_probe2 ? m_time_spent_in_probe2 / m_num_probe2 : 0),
510  m_num_probe2
511  );
512  OutputDebugString(buf);
513  }
514 #endif
515 
516  ReducerSegmentType GetCurrentSegmentType( void )
517  {
518  return m_curSegDataBlock->m_segType;
519  }
520 
521  int_type GetXStart( void )
522  {
523  return m_xstart;
524  }
525 
526  int_type GetXStop( void )
527  {
528  return m_curSegDataBlock->m_segStop;
529  }
530 
531  int_type ProducePixels( int_type numPix )
532  {
533  return t4::min<int_type>( numPix, GetXStop() - GetXStart() );
534  }
535 
537 
538  const int_rect_type& GetNonZeroBounds( void ) const
539  {
540  return m_nonZeroBounds;
541  }
542 
543  const int_rect_type& GetConstraintsBounds( void ) const
544  {
545  return m_constraints.m_interestBounds;
546  }
547 
548  void NextScanLine( int_type y );
549  void SetX( int_type x );
550 
551  ReducerSegmentType GetSegmentType( void ) const
552  {
553  return m_curSegDataBlock->m_segType;
554  }
555 
556  int_type GetSegmentStop( void ) const
557  {
558  return m_curSegDataBlock->m_segStop;
559  }
560 
561  // Returns pointer to x=0 value WHICH MAY NOT BE VALID OR ACCESSIBLE
562  // One should only use this to access x values in the constraint's interest bounds, and x=0 may not be such a value.
563  const real_type* GetPixelBuffer() const
564  {
565  return m_pixelBuffer;
566  }
567 
568  template<typename signal_traits>
569  typename signal_traits::signal_type * CopyPixels(typename signal_traits::signal_type *dest, int_type xStart, int_type xStop)
570  {
571  const real_type* pix = m_pixelBuffer;
572  for (int_type i = xStart; i < xStop; i++ )
573  *dest++ = signal_traits::real_to_signal( pix[i] );
574  return dest;
575  }
576 
577 private:
578  typedef edge_rec<real_type, int_type, point_type> edge_type;
579  typedef active_edge_rec<real_type, int_type, point_type> active_edge_type;
580 
581  void NewLineEdge( const point_type& p0, const point_type& p1 )
582  {
583  NewEdge( p0, p0, p1, p1, true );
584  }
585 
586  void NewCurveEdge( const point_type& p0, const point_type& p1,
587  const point_type& p2, const point_type& p3 );
588 
589  void SortActiveEdges();
590 
591  void NewEdge( const point_type& p0, const point_type& p1,
592  const point_type& p2, const point_type& p3,
593  bool isLine );
594 
595  void MakeActiveEdge(edge_type *edge);
596  void ClearActiveEdge(edge_type *edge);
597 
598  template<typename path_point_iterator_type>
599  void SkipContourIfOutsideClip( path_point_iterator_type& /*curPoint*/,
600  const path_point_iterator_type& /*end*/,
601  const matrix_type& /*mat*/ )
602  {}
603 
604  #ifndef NDEBUG
605  void assertWindingNumbersAreCorrect();
606  bool edgeIsCurrentlyActive( edge_type* e )
607  {
608  active_edge_type *active = e->activeData;
609  return active != nullptr && active->edgeSortsIndex >= 0 && active->edgeSortsIndex <= m_highestActiveEdgeIndex && m_edgeSorts[active->edgeSortsIndex] == e;
610  }
611  #endif
612 
613  int cmpEdgeTopToEdgeMiddle( edge_type* edge1, edge_type* edge2 );
614 
615  typedef edge_insertion_deletion_change<edge_type, real_type, edge_change_kind> edge_insertion_deletion_change_type;
616  typedef edge_intersection_change<edge_type, real_type, edge_change_kind> edge_intersection_change_type;
617 
618  void ComputeCrossingTable( edge_type* );
619 
620  void getXAndTValuesForYValue( edge_type* edge, real_type yVal, real_type& xVal
621 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
622  , real_type& tVal
623 #endif
624  );
625 
626  static edge_type* const kOffLeftEdge;
627 
628  edge_type* FindEdgeToLeft( edge_type* e )
629  {
630  for (int j = e->activeData->edgeSortsIndex - 1; j >= 0; --j)
631  if ( m_edgeSorts[j] )
632  return m_edgeSorts[j];
633  return kOffLeftEdge;
634  }
635 
636  // Yields "occasionally"
637  void ReducerYield( size_t cost )
638  {
639  m_yielder.Yield( static_cast<int>( cost ) );
640  }
641 
642  // Inserts edge and sets its edgeSortsIndex value.
643  // If necessary it shifts edges starting at index to the right to make room.
644  void InsertEdgeAtIndex( edge_type* e, int insertionIndex );
645  void FindEdgesInsertionIndex( edge_type** edge, int* index, int numEdges );
646  void ProcessNextEdgeInsertionDeletionChange( int_type scanLineY );
647  void ProcessNextEdgeIntersectionChange();
648  void EdgePairInsertionWorkhorse( bool processReverseRemoval );
649  void EdgePairRemovalWorkhorse( bool processForwardsRemoval );
650  void EdgeReplacementWorkhorse( bool processBackwards );
651  void EdgeSwapWorkhorse();
652  void SetEdgeTopDataForTopOfCurrentScanLine(int_type nextY);
653  void InitializeEdgeToTopOfScanLine( edge_type* edge, int_type scanLineY );
654  void ActivateEdge( edge_type* edge );
655  void AddTrans( edge_type* leftEdge, edge_type* rightEdge, real_type yBandMin, real_type yBandMax, bool firstBandInScanLine );
656  void AdjustSegmentListWhenProcessingSecondaryBands( int_type leftXMin_int, int_type leftXMax_int, int_type rightXMin_int, int_type rightXMax_int, real_type yBandMin, real_type yBandMax );
657  void AddIntersection(
658 #ifdef RECORD_INTERSECTION_X_VALUES
659  real_type x,
660 #endif
661  real_type y, edge_type* edge1, real_type t1, edge_type* edge2, real_type t2, real_type yBandMin
662  );
663 
664 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
665 // void PolishCurveCurveIntersection( const BezierSegment<point_type>& leftSeg, const BezierSegment<point_type>& rightSeg, IntersectionParameters<real_type>& params );
666  void InitLocalBezierObject( edge_type* edge, BezierSegment<point_type>& segment, real_type yBandMin, real_type yBandMax, bool transposedXandYAndEnsureYIsIncreasing = false );
667  void ComputeSignedAreaBetweenSegmentAndYAxis( const BezierSegment<point_type>& seg, real_type& area );
668  static void GetPowerSeriesCoefficientsFromBernsteinCoefficients( real_type a0, real_type a1, real_type a2, real_type a3, real_type* powerCoeff );
669  void InverseYOfBezierSegment( const BezierSegment<point_type>& seg, real_type y, real_type& t );
670  void SplitOffLowTSideOfBezierSegmentAtTPinningCentralYValue( BezierSegment<point_type>& seg, BezierSegment<point_type>& lowSeg, real_type t, real_type y );
671  void IntersectLineSegmentsWhichAreClosedAtTopAndOpenAtBottom( const IntervalBezierSegment<real_type>& bez0, const IntervalBezierSegment<real_type>& bez1, IntersectionParameters<real_type>* intersectionParams, int& numIntersections );
672  void recursiveIntervalBezierSubdivision( int remainingDepth0, int remainingDepth1,
673  const IntervalBezierSegment<real_type>& bez0, const IntervalBezierSegment<real_type>& bez1,
674  const IntersectionData<real_type>& id, IntersectionParameters<real_type>* params, int& numIntersections );
675  static int ComputeRequiredDepthForSegment( const BezierSegment<point_type>& seg );
676  int ComputeIntersectionInvolvingAtLeastOneCurve( edge_type* leftEdge, edge_type* rightEdge, real_type yBandMin, real_type yBandMax );
677 #endif
678 
679  static inline void GetMinMaxVals( real_type& xmin, real_type& xmax, edge_type* edge )
680  {
681  active_edge_type *active = edge->activeData;
682  if ( edge->deltaXSign < 0 ) {
683  xmin = active->curXBandBot;
684  xmax = active->curXBandTop;
685  } else {
686  xmin = active->curXBandTop;
687  xmax = active->curXBandBot;
688  }
689  tetraphilia_assert( xmin <= xmax );
690  }
691 
692  void FillPixels( real_type xmin, int_type ixmin, real_type xmax, int_type ixmax,
693 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
694  edge_type* edge,
695 #endif
696  real_type yBandMin, real_type yBandMax, bool areaToRight );

699  typedef ReducerSegmentData<int_type> reducer_segment_data_type;

702  t4::brief_ptr<reducer_segment_data_type> GetNewLooseSegmentDataBlock( void );
703 
704  t4::brief_ptr<edge_type> m_firstEdge;
705  t4::brief_ptr<edge_type> m_lastEdge;

707  size_t m_numEdges;
708  size_t m_numEdgeInsertionDeletions;
709  size_t m_numIntersectionRecords;
710  size_t m_numAllocatedIntersectionRecords;
711  size_t m_edgeSortsArraySize;

713  t4::brief_ptr<edge_type> m_firstEdgeOfContour;
714  t4::brief_ptr<edge_type*> m_edgeSorts;
715 
716  typedef TransientAllocator<app_traits> pool_allocator_type;
717 
718  struct pool_allocator
719  {
720  using size_type = std::size_t;
721  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
722 
723  static char * malloc( size_type bytes ) { return static_cast<char*>( t4::malloc( bytes ) ); }
724  static void free( char * const block ) { t4::free( block ); }
725  };
726 
727  static const size_t kSplitBezBuffSize = active_edge_type::kSplitBezBuffSize;
728  typedef typename active_edge_type::split_buf_type split_buf_type; // NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT can be 5 because of 4 points and a fifth psuedo point holding the t-start in x and the t-length in y.
729 
730  static const size_t crossing_buf_type_size = active_edge_type::crossing_buf_type_size;
731  typedef typename active_edge_type::crossing_buf_type crossing_buf_type;
732 
733  CostBasedConditionalYielder m_yielder;
734  boost::object_pool<active_edge_type, pool_allocator> m_activeEdgePool;
735  boost::object_pool<split_buf_type, pool_allocator> m_splitBufPool;
736  boost::object_pool<crossing_buf_type, pool_allocator> m_crossingBufPool;
737 
738  constraints_type m_constraints;
739 
740  int m_numActiveEdges;
741  int m_highestActiveEdgeIndex;
742  int m_curEdgeIntersectionIndex;
743 
744  const bool m_isEvenOddFill;
745  bool m_constraintsEmpty;
746 
747 #ifdef PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER
748  typename app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type m_time_spent_in_sampler_ctor;
749  typename app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type m_time_spent_in_NextScanLine;
750  int m_numTimesNextScanLineWasCalled;
751  typename app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type m_time_spent_in_intersection_checks;
752 
753  int m_numCurveIntersectionChecks;
754  typename app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type m_time_spent_in_InverseYOfBezierSegment;
755  int m_numTimesInverseYOfBezierSegmentWasCalled;
756  typename app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type m_time_spent_in_Inverse_in_getXAndTValuesForYValue;
757  int m_numTimesInverse_in_getXAndTValuesForYValueWasCalled;
758  typename app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type m_time_spent_in_Inverse_in_xminClipped_case;
759  int m_numTimesInverse_in_xminClipped_case;
760 
761  typename app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type m_time_spent_in_probe1;
762  int m_num_probe1;
763 
764  typename app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type m_time_spent_in_probe2;
765  int m_num_probe2;
766 
767  int m_callsTo_getXAndTValuesForYValue;
768  int m_cacheMissesFor_getXAndTValuesForYValue;
769 #endif
770 
771  t4::brief_ptr<edge_insertion_deletion_change_type> m_edge_insertion_deletion_buffer;
772  edge_insertion_deletion_change_type *m_curEdgeInsertionDeletion;
773  t4::brief_ptr<edge_intersection_change_type> m_edge_intersection_buffer;
774  edge_intersection_change_type *m_curEdgeIntersection;
775 
776  real_type m_xValBuff[forward_difference_limit<real_type>::kMaxSteps + 1];
777  real_type m_yValBuff[forward_difference_limit<real_type>::kMaxSteps + 1];
778 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
779  real_type m_xtValBuff[forward_difference_limit<real_type>::kMaxSteps + 1];
780  real_type m_ytValBuff[forward_difference_limit<real_type>::kMaxSteps + 1];
781 #endif
782 
783 
784  t4::brief_ptr<reducer_segment_data_type> m_firstSegDataBlock;
785  t4::brief_ptr<reducer_segment_data_type> m_lastSegDataBlock;
786  reducer_segment_data_type* m_curSegDataBlock;
787  reducer_segment_data_type* m_prevSegDataBlock;
788 
789  int_rect_type m_nonZeroBounds;
790  int_type m_xstart;
791  int_type m_curScanLine;
792  int_type m_endOfLastSegmentProcessedInCurrentBand;
793  t4::brief_ptr<real_type> m_allocatedBuffer;
794  real_type* m_pixelBuffer;
795 };
796 
797 template<typename app_traits>
798 typename bezier_sampler<app_traits>::edge_type* const bezier_sampler<app_traits>::kOffLeftEdge = reinterpret_cast<edge_type*>( std::uintptr_t{1} );
799 
800 template<typename app_traits>
801 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::SetX( int_type x )
802 {
803  m_xstart = x;
804  if ( m_prevSegDataBlock->m_segStop > x ) {
805  m_prevSegDataBlock = t4::get_ptr( m_firstSegDataBlock );
806  m_curSegDataBlock = t4::get_ptr( m_firstSegDataBlock->m_next );
807  }
808  tetraphilia_assert( m_prevSegDataBlock->m_segStop <= m_curSegDataBlock->m_segStop );
809  while ( m_curSegDataBlock->m_segStop <= x ) {
810  m_prevSegDataBlock = m_curSegDataBlock;
811  m_curSegDataBlock = t4::get_ptr( m_curSegDataBlock->m_next );
812  tetraphilia_assert( m_prevSegDataBlock->m_segStop <= m_curSegDataBlock->m_segStop );
813  }
814 }
815 
816 template<typename _edge_type, typename _real_type, typename _edge_change_kind>
817 int edge_insertion_deletion_change<_edge_type,_real_type,_edge_change_kind>::compareInsertionDeletionChanges( const void* e1, const void* e2, void* /*unused*/ )
818 {
819  tetraphilia_assert( static_cast<const edge_insertion_deletion_change*>(e1)->m_type == k_terminator || static_cast<const edge_insertion_deletion_change*>(e1)->m_type == k_insert || static_cast<const edge_insertion_deletion_change*>(e1)->m_type == k_remove || static_cast<const edge_insertion_deletion_change*>(e1)->m_type == k_replace );
820  tetraphilia_assert( static_cast<const edge_insertion_deletion_change*>(e2)->m_type == k_terminator || static_cast<const edge_insertion_deletion_change*>(e2)->m_type == k_insert || static_cast<const edge_insertion_deletion_change*>(e2)->m_type == k_remove || static_cast<const edge_insertion_deletion_change*>(e2)->m_type == k_replace );
821  // sort first by y-value, putting smaller y-values first
822  if ( static_cast<const edge_insertion_deletion_change*>(e1)->m_yVal < static_cast<const edge_insertion_deletion_change*>(e2)->m_yVal )
823  return -1;
824  if ( static_cast<const edge_insertion_deletion_change*>(e1)->m_yVal > static_cast<const edge_insertion_deletion_change*>(e2)->m_yVal )
825  return 1;
826  return 0;
827 }
828 
829 template<typename _edge_type, typename _real_type, typename _edge_change_kind>
830 bool edge_intersection_change<_edge_type,_real_type,_edge_change_kind>::compareIntersectionChanges( const edge_intersection_change& e1, const edge_intersection_change& e2 )
831 {
832  tetraphilia_assert( e1.m_type == k_terminator || e1.m_type == k_swap || e1.m_type == k_swapAtTopOfBand );
833  tetraphilia_assert( e2.m_type == k_terminator || e2.m_type == k_swap || e2.m_type == k_swapAtTopOfBand );
834 
835  // sort first by y-value, putting smaller y-values first
836  if ( e1.m_yVal < e2.m_yVal )
837  return true;
838  if ( e1.m_yVal > e2.m_yVal )
839  return false;
840  // if the y-values are equal, then put the INSERTIONS first and the REMOVALS last
841  // as we should put any intersections between the two to ensure they make sense.
842  if ( e1.m_type != e2.m_type ) {
843  if ( e1.m_type == k_swapAtTopOfBand )
844  return false;
845  else
846  return true;
847  }
848  return false;
849 }
850 
851 template<typename app_traits>
852 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::InsertEdgeAtIndex( edge_type* e, int insertionIndex )
853 {
854  int highestIndexTouched;
855  if ( m_edgeSorts[insertionIndex] == nullptr ) {
856  highestIndexTouched = insertionIndex;
857  }
858  else {
859  // Shift edges to right of insertionIndex by one slot until we hit a null edge
860  for (highestIndexTouched = insertionIndex; highestIndexTouched <= m_highestActiveEdgeIndex && m_edgeSorts[highestIndexTouched] != nullptr; ++highestIndexTouched )
861  {}
862  for (int k = highestIndexTouched; k > insertionIndex; --k) {
863  tetraphilia_assert( m_edgeSorts[k-1] != NULL );
864  m_edgeSorts[k] = m_edgeSorts[k-1];
865  tetraphilia_assert( m_edgeSorts[k]->activeData->edgeSortsIndex == k - 1 );
866  m_edgeSorts[k]->activeData->edgeSortsIndex = k;
867  ReducerYield( 1 );
868  }
869  }
870  if ( highestIndexTouched > m_highestActiveEdgeIndex ) {
871  tetraphilia_assert( highestIndexTouched == m_highestActiveEdgeIndex + 1 );
872  m_highestActiveEdgeIndex = highestIndexTouched;
873  tetraphilia_assert( m_highestActiveEdgeIndex < static_cast<int>( m_edgeSortsArraySize ) );
874  }
875  m_edgeSorts[insertionIndex] = e;
876  m_edgeSorts[insertionIndex]->activeData->edgeSortsIndex = insertionIndex;
877 }
878 
879 template<typename app_traits>
880 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::AddIntersection(
881 #ifdef RECORD_INTERSECTION_X_VALUES
882  real_type x,
883 #endif
884  real_type y,
885  edge_type* edge1,
886  real_type t1,
887  edge_type* edge2,
888  real_type t2,
889  real_type yBandMin )
890 {
891  // as long as we are only finding intersections for scanlines we process, this should hold true
892  tetraphilia_assert( get_ymin(m_nonZeroBounds) <= y && y <= get_ymax(m_nonZeroBounds) ); // might be able to tighten second inequality to be strict
893  tetraphilia_assert( m_numIntersectionRecords <= m_numAllocatedIntersectionRecords );
894 
895  if ( m_numIntersectionRecords == m_numAllocatedIntersectionRecords ) {
896  // realloc intersection records
897  size_t newSize = t4::add<size_t>( m_numAllocatedIntersectionRecords,
898  (m_numAllocatedIntersectionRecords >> 1) + 10 ); // grow arithmetically when small, geometrically when large
899  // overflow would require billions of intersections in a scanline
900 
901  auto newBuffer = t4::make_brief_array<edge_intersection_change_type>( newSize );
902  ::memcpy( t4::get_ptr( newBuffer ), t4::get_ptr( m_edge_intersection_buffer ), sizeof(edge_intersection_change_type) * m_numIntersectionRecords );
903  edge_intersection_change_type* newCurIntersection = t4::get_ptr( newBuffer ) + ( m_curEdgeIntersection - t4::get_ptr( m_edge_intersection_buffer ) );
904  tetraphilia_assert( m_curEdgeIntersection - t4::get_ptr( m_edge_intersection_buffer ) == newCurIntersection - t4::get_ptr( newBuffer ) );
905 
906  m_curEdgeIntersection = std::move( newCurIntersection );
907  m_edge_intersection_buffer = std::move( newBuffer );
908  m_numAllocatedIntersectionRecords = newSize;
909  }
910 
911  tetraphilia_assert( m_numIntersectionRecords < m_numAllocatedIntersectionRecords );
912 
913  edge_intersection_change_type* ec = &m_edge_intersection_buffer[m_numIntersectionRecords++];
914  ec->m_edge[0] = edge1;
915  ec->m_edge[1] = edge2;
916  ec->m_yVal = y;
917 #ifdef RECORD_INTERSECTION_X_VALUES
918  ec->m_xVal = x;
919 #endif
920  ec->m_t[0] = t1;
921  ec->m_t[1] = t2;
922  tetraphilia_assert( y >= yBandMin );
923  tetraphilia_assert( get_y(edge1->top()) <= y && y <= get_y(edge1->bot()) );
924  tetraphilia_assert( get_y(edge2->top()) <= y && y <= get_y(edge2->bot()) );
925 
926 #ifdef RECORD_INTERSECTION_X_VALUES
927  // I forget exactly why, but I think these asserts can fail for some reason
928  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( (get_x(edge1->top()) <= x && x <= get_x(edge1->bot())) || (get_x(edge1->bot()) <= x && x <= get_x(edge1->top())) );
929  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( (get_x(edge2->top()) <= x && x <= get_x(edge2->bot())) || (get_x(edge2->bot()) <= x && x <= get_x(edge2->top())) );
930 #endif
931 
932  tetraphilia_assert( 0 <= t1 && t1 <= 1 );
933  tetraphilia_assert( 0 <= t2 && t2 <= 1 );
934  ec->m_type = (y != yBandMin) ? k_swap : k_swapAtTopOfBand;
935 }
936 
937 template<typename app_traits>
938 t4::brief_ptr<typename bezier_sampler<app_traits>::reducer_segment_data_type> bezier_sampler<app_traits>::NewSegmentDataBlock( void )
939 {
940  if ( m_lastSegDataBlock->m_next )
941  return m_lastSegDataBlock->m_next;
942  auto ns = t4::make_brief<reducer_segment_data_type>();
943  m_lastSegDataBlock->m_next = ns;
944  ns->m_next = {};
945  return ns;
946 }
947 
948 template<typename app_traits>
949 t4::brief_ptr<typename bezier_sampler<app_traits>::reducer_segment_data_type> bezier_sampler<app_traits>::GetNewLooseSegmentDataBlock( void )
950 {
951  t4::brief_ptr<reducer_segment_data_type> ns;
952  // if there's a spare segment after the current last segment, extract it from the list, otherwise allocate a new one
953  if ( m_lastSegDataBlock->m_next ) {
954  ns = m_lastSegDataBlock->m_next;
955  m_lastSegDataBlock->m_next = ns->m_next;
956  }
957  else
958  ns = t4::make_brief<reducer_segment_data_type>();
959 
960  #ifdef _DEBUG
961  memset( &ns->m_segType, 0xbb, sizeof( ns->m_segType ) );
962  memset( &ns->m_segStop, 0xbb, sizeof( ns->m_segStop ) );
963  #endif
964 
965  return ns;
966 }
967 
968 template<typename _real_type, typename _int_type>
969 struct call_YFill
970 {
971  typedef _real_type real_type;
972  typedef _int_type int_type;
973 
974  static void Fill( real_type p0, real_type p1, real_type p2, real_type p3,
975  size_t numSteps, real_type* yTable
976 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
977  , real_type* tTable, real_type tStart, real_type tLength
978 #endif
979  )
980  {
981  FillBezTable( p0, p1, p2, p3, numSteps, yTable
982 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
983  , tTable, tStart, tLength
984 #endif
985  );
986  }
987 };
988 
989 // TODO
990 // our gcc builds are currently using "whole archive" in the link step
991 // and this is causing the linker to skip the step where it would trim
992 // out any unused code. When that is combined with our specializations
993 // for float and double call_YFill it causes the gcc build to include
994 // a bunch of float and double code that is never used. So on those
995 // builds we explicitly skip the specializations. The real fix to this
996 // is to modify the perl scripts that are driving the gcc build so that
997 // it doesn't specify the "whole archive" flag.
998 #ifdef __arm__
999 // #define SKIP_FLOAT_AND_DOUBLE_CALL_Y_FILL_SPECIALIZATIONS
1000 #endif
1001 
1002 template<>
1003 struct call_YFill<float, std::int32_t>
1004 #ifndef SKIP_FLOAT_AND_DOUBLE_CALL_Y_FILL_SPECIALIZATIONS
1005 {
1006  typedef float real_type;
1007  typedef std::int32_t int_type;
1008 
1009  static void Fill( real_type p0, real_type p1, real_type p2, real_type p3,
1010  size_t numSteps, real_type* yTable
1011 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
1012  , real_type* tTable, real_type tStart, real_type tLength
1013 #endif
1014  )
1015  {
1016  /*
1017  What is this crazyness?
1018 
1019  Well, it all has to do with speeding up floating work on
1020  x86 chips. FillYCrossingTable essentially works by stepping through
1021  the (floating point) samples in the x and y value buffers until it
1022  finds two adjacent samples where floor(yVal[i]) != floor(yVal[i+1]).
1023  It then approximates the x value at which the bezier curve leaves
1024  the i'th scanline by assuming that the curve is a line between the i'th
1025  and i'th + 1 sample points. But to do this it has to perform a lot of
1026  "floor" operations. To speed this up we make use of a few realizations.
1027  First, the values in the yVals buffer are all fairly close to each other.
1028  Other than roundoff problems, each one is within 1 of each of its neighbors.
1029  Since we have a fairly small upper bound on the number of samples we
1030  are willing to put in a single array (25) we end up being guaranteed
1031  that abs(yVals[0] - yVals[numSamples]) is not much bigger than 25.
1032 
1033  Now, the way 32 bit IEEE floating values are arranged, all numbers greater
1034  than or equal to 2^k, and less than 2^(k+1) end up using the same range
1035  of bits to store the fractional part of the number. This means that
1036  there exists a 32 bit binary mask of the form [1, 1, 1, .... 1, 0, .... 0, 0]
1037  where if you AND that mask with any 32 bit IEEE number between 2^k
1038  and 2^(k+1) you will get the floor of that number.
1039 
1040  The game here is to offset the y values of the 4 control points for the
1041  curve so that they are known to all be between 64 and 128. This means
1042  that all of the generated sample points will also be between 64 and
1043  128. With this done, FillYCrossingTable just uses an integer mask
1044  and integer instructions when finding two samples in the buffers
1045  such that the floor(yVals[i]) != floor(yVals[i+1]).
1046 
1047  */
1048  real_type offset = 0;//64 - real_to_int<real_type, int_type>::Floor( p0 );
1049  FillBezTable( p0 + offset, p1 + offset, p2 + offset,
1050  p3 + offset, numSteps, yTable
1051 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
1052  , tTable, tStart, tLength
1053 #endif
1054  );
1055 
1056  }
1057 }
1058 #endif
1059 ;
1060 
1061 template<>
1062 struct call_YFill<double, std::int32_t>
1063 #ifndef SKIP_FLOAT_AND_DOUBLE_CALL_Y_FILL_SPECIALIZATIONS
1064 {
1065  typedef double real_type;
1066  typedef std::int32_t int_type;
1067 
1068  static void Fill( real_type p0, real_type p1, real_type p2, real_type p3,
1069  size_t numSteps, real_type* yTable
1070 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
1071  , real_type* tTable, real_type tStart, real_type tLength
1072 #endif
1073  )
1074  {
1075  /*
1076  What is this crazyness?
1077 
1078  Well, it all has to do with speeding up floating work on
1079  x86 chips. FillYCrossingTable essentially works by stepping through
1080  the (floating point) samples in the x and y value buffers until it
1081  finds two adjacent samples where floor(yVal[i]) != floor(yVal[i+1]).
1082  It then approximates the x value at which the bezier curve leaves
1083  the i'th scanline by assuming that the curve is a line between the i'th
1084  and i'th + 1 sample points. But to do this it has to perform a lot of
1085  "floor" operations. To speed this up we make use of a few realizations.
1086  First, the values in the yVals buffer are all fairly close to each other.
1087  Other than roundoff problems, each one is within 1 of each of its neighbors.
1088  Since we have a fairly small upper bound on the number of samples we
1089  are willing to put in a single array (25) we end up being guaranteed
1090  that abs(yVals[0] - yVals[numSamples]) is not much bigger than 25.
1091 
1092  Now, the way 32 bit IEEE floating values are arranged, all numbers greater
1093  than or equal to 2^k, and less than 2^(k+1) end up using the same range
1094  of bits to store the fractional part of the number. This means that
1095  there exists a 32 bit binary mask of the form [1, 1, 1, .... 1, 0, .... 0, 0]
1096  where if you AND that mask with any 32 bit IEEE number between 2^k
1097  and 2^(k+1) you will get the floor of that number.
1098 
1099  The game here is to offset the y values of the 4 control points for the
1100  curve so that they are known to all be between 64 and 128. This means
1101  that all of the generated sample points will also be between 64 and
1102  128. With this done, FillYCrossingTable just uses an integer mask
1103  and integer instructions when finding two samples in the buffers
1104  such that the floor(yVals[i]) != floor(yVals[i+1]).
1105 
1106  */
1107  real_type offset = 0;//64 - real_to_int<real_type, int_type>::Floor( p0 );
1108  FillBezTable( p0 + offset, p1 + offset, p2 + offset,
1109  p3 + offset, numSteps, yTable
1110 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
1111  , tTable, tStart, tLength
1112 #endif
1113  );
1114 
1115  }
1116 }
1117 #endif
1118 ;
1119 
1120 // Compare the x values of the top of edge1 and the point of edge2 at the same y-value.
1121 template<typename app_traits>
1122 int bezier_sampler<app_traits>::cmpEdgeTopToEdgeMiddle( edge_type* edge1, edge_type* edge2 )
1123 {
1124  // check top points
1125  real_type yTop = get_y( edge1->top() );
1126  tetraphilia_assert( get_y(edge2->top()) <= yTop && yTop <= get_y(edge2->bot()) );
1127 
1128  real_type x1 = get_x( edge1->top() );
1129  real_type x2;
1130 
1131  if (yTop == get_y( edge2->top() )) {
1132  x2 = get_x( edge2->top() );
1133  } else {
1134  if (edge2->isLine) {
1135  real_type t = (yTop - get_y(edge2->top())) * edge2->deltaYInverse;
1136  PrecisionGuardian<real_type>::InFixedPointBuildsShiftAsNecessary( t, edge2->deltaYInverseShift );
1137  tetraphilia_assert( 0 <= t && t <= real_type(1.001f) ); // not 1 because disivion can introduce significant errors
1138  x2 = get_x(edge2->top()) + t * edge2->deltaX;
1139  // this assert can possible fail in strange cases when t is slightly above 0 or below 1?
1140  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x(edge2->top()) <= x2 && x2 <= real_services::AddAndPin(get_x(edge2->bot()), edge2->deltaX * real_type(0.001f))) ||
1141  (real_services::AddAndPin(get_x(edge2->bot()), edge2->deltaX * real_type(0.001f)) <= x2 && x2 <= get_x(edge2->top())) );
1142  }
1143  else {
1144 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
1145  real_type t;
1146 #endif
1147  getXAndTValuesForYValue( edge2, yTop, x2
1148 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
1149  , t
1150 #endif
1151  );
1152  }
1153  }
1154 
1155  real_type d = x1 - x2;
1156  if ( d < 0 )
1157  return -1;
1158  else if ( d > 0 )
1159  return 1;
1160  // secondary lexicographical check is bottoms, which will often be correct
1161  d = get_x(edge1->bot()) - get_x(edge2->bot());
1162  if ( d < 0 )
1163  return -1;
1164  else if ( d > 0 )
1165  return 1;
1166  // otherwise, we'll call it a tie here
1167  return 0;
1168 }
1169 
1170 template<typename app_traits>
1171  template<typename Rng>
1172 bezier_sampler<app_traits>::bezier_sampler( Rng&& bez_segments,
1173  const constraints_type& constraints,
1174  const matrix_type& mat,
1175  bool isEvenOddFill )
1176  : m_firstEdge{},
1177  m_lastEdge{},
1178  m_numEdges(0),
1179  m_edgeSortsArraySize(0),
1180  m_constraints(constraints),
1181  m_isEvenOddFill( isEvenOddFill ),
1182  m_firstSegDataBlock( t4::make_brief<reducer_segment_data_type>() )
1183 {
1184 #ifdef PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER
1185  app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type start_ctor_time = app_traits::context_type::current_time();
1186  m_time_spent_in_NextScanLine = 0;
1187  m_numTimesNextScanLineWasCalled = 0;
1188 
1189  m_time_spent_in_intersection_checks = 0;
1190  m_numCurveIntersectionChecks = 0;
1191 
1192  m_time_spent_in_InverseYOfBezierSegment = 0;
1193  m_numTimesInverseYOfBezierSegmentWasCalled = 0;
1194 
1195  m_time_spent_in_Inverse_in_getXAndTValuesForYValue = 0;
1196  m_numTimesInverse_in_getXAndTValuesForYValueWasCalled = 0;
1197 
1198  m_time_spent_in_Inverse_in_xminClipped_case = 0;
1199  m_numTimesInverse_in_xminClipped_case = 0;
1200 
1201  m_time_spent_in_probe1 = 0;
1202  m_num_probe1 = 0;
1203 
1204  m_time_spent_in_probe2 = 0;
1205  m_num_probe2 = 0;
1206 
1207  m_callsTo_getXAndTValuesForYValue = 0;
1208  m_cacheMissesFor_getXAndTValuesForYValue = 0;
1209 
1210 #endif
1211 
1212  m_firstSegDataBlock->m_segStop = limits<int_type>::min();
1213  m_firstSegDataBlock->m_next = {};
1214  m_lastSegDataBlock = m_firstSegDataBlock; // keep m_lastSegDataBlock valid, especially for empty constraints block below
1215 
1216  // if constraints are empty we will not do any work
1217  if ( RectIsEmpty( m_constraints.m_interestBounds ) ) {
1218  m_constraintsEmpty = true;
1219  m_firstSegDataBlock->m_next = NewSegmentDataBlock();
1220  m_lastSegDataBlock = m_firstSegDataBlock->m_next;
1221  m_lastSegDataBlock->m_segStop = limits<int_type>::max();
1222  m_lastSegDataBlock->m_segType = kZero;
1223  m_lastSegDataBlock->m_next = {};
1224  MakeEmptyRect(m_nonZeroBounds);
1225  return;
1226  }
1227 
1228  m_constraintsEmpty = false;
1229 
1230  // The current m_pixelBuffer strategy assumes the following fact is true
1231  tetraphilia_assert( m_constraints.m_bufferXMin <= get_xmin(m_constraints.m_interestBounds) && get_xmax(m_constraints.m_interestBounds) <= m_constraints.m_bufferXMax );
1232 
1233  auto start = bez_segments.begin();
1234  auto end = bez_segments.end();
1235 
1236  auto curPoint = start;
1237 
1238  bool contourIsOpen = false;
1239  bool doingAutoClose = false;
1240  point_type p0, p1, p2, p3, moveToPoint = MakePoint<point_type>( 0, 0 );
1241 
1242  // Watson bug#1297644
1243  // permissive builds allow invalid paths to be constructed. If we detect one here we act as if the path were empty
1244  #ifdef TETRAPHILIA_PDF_PERMISSIVE
1245  if ( curPoint != end && (*curPoint).type() != t4::path_op::moveto && (*curPoint).type() != t4::path_op::closepath )
1246  curPoint = end;
1247  #else
1248  tetraphilia_assert( curPoint == end || (*curPoint).type() == t4::path_op::move_to || (*curPoint).type() == t4::path_op::close_path );
1249  #endif
1250 
1251 
1252  /* assert that the clip is "well formed" both in terms of ymax >= ymin
1253  AND making sure that ymax - ymin isn't so big that it wraps around
1254  0 and becomes negative */
1255  tetraphilia_assert( get_ymax(m_constraints.m_interestBounds) - get_ymin(m_constraints.m_interestBounds) >= 0 );
1256 
1257  set_xmin(m_nonZeroBounds, limits<int_type>::max());
1258  set_xmax(m_nonZeroBounds, limits<int_type>::min());
1259  m_firstEdgeOfContour = {};
1260 
1261  auto finish_close = [&]()
1262  {
1263  if ( m_firstEdgeOfContour ) {
1264 
1265  // if we generated at least one edge, it should not be possible
1266  // for us to have generated exactly one edge
1267  tetraphilia_assert( m_firstEdgeOfContour != m_lastEdge );
1268 
1269  // stitch together the first and last edge of this contour
1270  // by setting the "belowEdge" fields and possibly resetting the isFirstOfYMinPair fields
1271 
1272  // If the first edge in this contour goes up, then we will have not
1273  // set its "belowEdge" field yet. And it has to be set to either
1274  // the last edge in the contour (if it also goes up) or zero (if
1275  // it goes down -- meaning that there is a local y maximum there).
1276  // Otherwise if both the first and last edge go down we can set the
1277  // last edge's "belowEdge" field to the first edge.
1278  if ( m_firstEdgeOfContour->windingNum < 0 ) {
1279  if ( m_lastEdge->windingNum < 0 ) {
1280  // first and last edge both going "up"
1281  m_firstEdgeOfContour->belowEdge = m_lastEdge;
1282 
1283  // Usually, the bottom of m_firstEdgeOfContour and the top of m_lastEdge
1284  // will be the same here (they should ALWAYS have the same y value).
1285  // If they are not the same point then we need to allocate an extra spot in
1286  // the m_edgeSorts list for when this transition happens.
1287  tetraphilia_assert( get_y(m_lastEdge->top()) == get_y(m_firstEdgeOfContour->bot()) );
1288  if ( get_x(m_lastEdge->top()) != get_x(m_firstEdgeOfContour->bot()) )
1289  ++m_edgeSortsArraySize;
1290  }
1291  else {
1292  // last edge going "down", first edge going "up"
1293  m_firstEdgeOfContour->belowEdge = {};
1294  m_lastEdge->belowEdge = {};
1295  m_lastEdge->isFirstOfYMaxPair = true;
1296  }
1297  }
1298  else {
1299  if ( m_lastEdge->windingNum > 0 ) {
1300  // first and last edge both going "down"
1301  m_lastEdge->belowEdge = m_firstEdgeOfContour;
1302 
1303  // Usually, the top of m_firstEdgeOfContour and the bottom of m_lastEdge
1304  // will be the same here (they should ALWAYS have the same y value).
1305  // If they are not the same point then we need to allocate an extra spot in
1306  // the m_edgeSorts list for when this transition happens.
1307  tetraphilia_assert( get_y(m_firstEdgeOfContour->top()) == get_y(m_lastEdge->bot()) );
1308  if ( get_x(m_firstEdgeOfContour->top()) != get_x(m_lastEdge->bot()) )
1309  ++m_edgeSortsArraySize;
1310  }
1311  else {
1312  // last edge going "up", first edge going "down"
1313  m_lastEdge->isFirstOfYMinPair = true;
1314  m_edgeSortsArraySize += 2;
1315  }
1316  }
1317 
1318  m_firstEdgeOfContour = {};
1319  }
1320 
1321  contourIsOpen = false;
1322  };
1323 
1324  auto close_contour = [&]()
1325  {
1326  // sample a line from our last point back to the last moveto point
1327 
1328  if ( (get_x(p0) != get_x(moveToPoint)) || (get_y(p0) != get_y(moveToPoint)) ) {
1329  doingAutoClose = true;
1330  NewLineEdge( p0, moveToPoint );
1331  }
1332 
1333  finish_close();
1334  };
1335 
1336  // main body of routine loops through all the segments in the
1337  // path and calls either NewLineEdge or NewCurveEdge on each one.
1338  while ( curPoint != end ) {
1339 
1340  ReducerYield( 500 );
1341 
1342  auto moveto = [&]( t4::real_point const& pp0 )
1343  {
1344  // if the contour is still open (there wasn't an explicit closepath
1345  // before this moveto) then close it before continuing
1346  if ( contourIsOpen )
1347  close_contour();
1348 
1349  tetraphilia_assert( !m_firstEdgeOfContour ); // this should always be true here and must be enforced
1350  p0 = moveToPoint = MatrixTransform( mat, pp0 );
1351  SkipContourIfOutsideClip( curPoint, end, mat );
1352  };
1353 
1354  auto curveto = [&]( t4::real_point const& pp0, t4::real_point const& pp1, t4::real_point const& pp2 )
1355  {
1356  p1 = MatrixTransform( mat, pp0 );
1357  p2 = MatrixTransform( mat, pp1 );
1358  p3 = MatrixTransform( mat, pp2 );
1359  NewCurveEdge( p0, p1, p2, p3 );
1360  p0 = p3;
1361  contourIsOpen = true;
1362  };
1363 
1364  auto lineto = [&]( t4::real_point const& pp0 )
1365  {
1366  p3 = MatrixTransform( mat, pp0 );
1367  NewLineEdge( p0, p3 );
1368  p0 = p3;
1369  contourIsOpen = true;
1370  };
1371 
1372  auto closepath = [&]( void )
1373  {
1374  // PostScript rules state "If the current subpath is already
1375  // closed or the current path is empty, closepath does not
1376  // do anything"
1377  if ( !contourIsOpen )
1378  return;
1379  p3 = moveToPoint;
1380  NewLineEdge( p0, p3 );
1381  p0 = p3;
1382  doingAutoClose = false;
1383  finish_close();
1384  };
1385 
1386  // accessing the op once is more efficient than getting it on each test
1387  (*curPoint++).visit( moveto, lineto, curveto, closepath );
1388  }
1389 
1390  // if we have stepped through all the points in the path
1391  // and we have not added the last closepath segment then we
1392  // need to add it. Otherwise we are done.
1393  if ( contourIsOpen )
1394  close_contour();
1395 
1396  // Not including edge changes representing intersections, there should be exactly m_numEdges such records since
1397  // each edge change record records an event for two edges, and each edge has an event at its top and its bottom.
1398  // We allocate slightly more to allow for some intersections, although the intersection records will overwrite
1399  // any edge change records for preceeding scanlines. We also allow for the 2 terminator records we place at the start and end.
1400  m_edge_insertion_deletion_buffer = t4::make_brief_array<edge_insertion_deletion_change_type>( m_numEdges + 2 );
1401  edge_insertion_deletion_change_type* ec = t4::get_ptr( m_edge_insertion_deletion_buffer );
1402  set_ymin(m_nonZeroBounds, limits<int_type>::max());
1403  set_ymax(m_nonZeroBounds, limits<int_type>::min());
1404 
1405  m_numAllocatedIntersectionRecords = 8;
1406  m_edge_intersection_buffer = t4::make_brief_array<edge_intersection_change_type>( m_numAllocatedIntersectionRecords );
1407 
1408  m_edge_intersection_buffer[0].m_yVal = limits<real_type>::min(); // terminator edge_change record given most negative y value
1409  ec->m_yVal = limits<real_type>::min(); // terminator edge_change record given most negative y value
1410 
1411  m_edge_intersection_buffer[0].m_type = k_terminator;
1412  ec->m_type = k_terminator;
1413  ++ec;
1414 
1415  m_edgeSorts = t4::make_brief_array<edge_type*>( m_edgeSortsArraySize );
1416  ::memset( t4::get_ptr( m_edgeSorts ), 0, sizeof(edge_type*) * m_edgeSortsArraySize ); // initialize list with NULLs
1417  m_numActiveEdges = 0;
1418 
1419  // loop over all edges, creating edge_change records for insertion, removal and replacement of edges,
1420  // with the exception of edges which cross the top of the nzBounds, for those we simply populate
1421  // the m_edgeSorts list and do not create an associated edge_change record.
1422  edge_type* edge = t4::get_ptr( m_firstEdge );
1423  edge_type* firstEdgeOfContour = nullptr;
1424 
1425  while ( edge ) {
1426 
1427  ReducerYield( 100 );
1428 
1429  if ( edge->isFirstEdgeOfContour ) {
1430  tetraphilia_assert( edge->nextEdge ); // should not be possible to have a single edge in a contour since upon closure (whether explicit or implicit) it would have received a second edge.
1431  firstEdgeOfContour = edge;
1432  }
1433 
1434  if ( edge->isFirstOfYMinPair ) {
1435  auto edge2 = (edge->nextEdge && !edge->nextEdge->isFirstEdgeOfContour) ? t4::get_ptr( edge->nextEdge ) : firstEdgeOfContour;
1436  tetraphilia_assert( edge2 );
1437  if ( get_y(edge->top()) <= get_ymin(m_constraints.m_interestBounds) ) {
1438  // if true for one, must be true for both, and even more can be asserted here as follows
1439  tetraphilia_assert( get_y(edge->top()) <= get_ymin(m_constraints.m_interestBounds) && get_y(edge->bot()) > get_ymin(m_constraints.m_interestBounds) );
1440  tetraphilia_assert( get_y(edge2->top()) <= get_ymin(m_constraints.m_interestBounds) && get_y(edge2->bot()) > get_ymin(m_constraints.m_interestBounds) );
1441 
1442  // Do not create edge_change record for edges which start at or above the top of the constraints
1443  // simply add these edges to the m_edgeSorts array (they will be sorted below)
1444  m_edgeSorts[m_numActiveEdges++] = edge;
1445  m_edgeSorts[m_numActiveEdges++] = edge2;
1446  int_type tmp = real_services::FloorToInt( ArgType<int_type>(), t4::min<real_type>( get_y(edge->top()), get_y(edge2->top()) ) );
1447  if ( get_ymin(m_nonZeroBounds) > tmp )
1448  set_ymin(m_nonZeroBounds, tmp);
1449  }
1450  else {
1451  // either the edges have the same top or they are connected by horizontal lines
1452  tetraphilia_assert( get_y(edge->top()) == get_y(edge2->top()) );
1453  ec->m_yVal = get_y(edge->top());
1454  ec->m_type = k_insert;
1455  if ( cmpEdgeTopToEdgeMiddle( edge, edge2 ) <= 0 ) {
1456  ec->m_edge[0] = edge;
1457  ec->m_edge[1] = edge2;
1458  } else {
1459  ec->m_edge[0] = edge2;
1460  ec->m_edge[1] = edge;
1461  }
1462  ec++;
1463  }
1464  }
1465  if ( edge->isFirstOfYMaxPair ) {
1466  tetraphilia_assert( !edge->belowEdge );
1467  auto edge2 = (edge->nextEdge && !edge->nextEdge->isFirstEdgeOfContour) ? t4::get_ptr( edge->nextEdge ) : firstEdgeOfContour;
1468  tetraphilia_assert( edge2 != nullptr );
1469  if ( get_y(edge->bot()) < get_ymax(m_constraints.m_interestBounds ) || get_y(edge2->bot()) < get_ymax(m_constraints.m_interestBounds ) )
1470  {
1471  tetraphilia_assert( get_y(edge->bot()) == get_y(edge2->bot()) );
1472  ec->m_edge[0] = edge;
1473  ec->m_edge[1] = edge2;
1474  ec->m_yVal = get_y(edge->bot());
1475  ec->m_type = k_remove;
1476  ++ec;
1477  }
1478  else {
1479  // Currently don't bother to create edge_change record when the bottoms of both edges are below the constraints.m_interestBound
1480  // But we must push down the nonZeroBounds yMax.
1481  int_type nextScanLineBelowEdge = real_services::CeilToInt(ArgType<int_type>(), get_y(edge->bot()));
1482  if ( get_ymax(m_nonZeroBounds) < nextScanLineBelowEdge )
1483  set_ymax(m_nonZeroBounds, nextScanLineBelowEdge );
1484  }
1485  }
1486  else if ( edge->belowEdge ) {
1487  // not first or second of YMax pair
1488  ec->m_edge[0] = edge;
1489  ec->m_edge[1] = t4::get_ptr( edge->belowEdge );
1490  ec->m_yVal = get_y(edge->bot());
1491  ec->m_type = k_replace;
1492  ++ec;
1493  }
1494 
1495  real_type xmin = get_x(edge->top());
1496  real_type xmax = get_x(edge->bot());
1497  if ( xmin > xmax )
1498  boost::swap( xmin, xmax );
1499  int_type xIntMin = real_services::FloorToInt(ArgType<int_type>(), xmin);
1500  int_type xIntMax = real_services::CeilToInt(ArgType<int_type>(), xmax);
1501  if ( xIntMin < get_xmin(m_nonZeroBounds) )
1502  set_xmin(m_nonZeroBounds, xIntMin );
1503  if ( xIntMax >= get_xmax(m_nonZeroBounds) )
1504  set_xmax(m_nonZeroBounds, xIntMax);
1505 
1506  edge = t4::get_ptr( edge->nextEdge );
1507  }
1508  ec->m_yVal = limits<real_type>::max(); // terminator edge_change record given maximal y value
1509  ec->m_type = k_terminator;
1510  ++ec;
1511 
1512  m_highestActiveEdgeIndex = m_numActiveEdges - 1;
1513  tetraphilia_assert( m_highestActiveEdgeIndex < static_cast<int>( m_edgeSortsArraySize ) );
1514 
1515  m_numEdgeInsertionDeletions = static_cast<size_t>( ec - t4::get_ptr( m_edge_insertion_deletion_buffer ) ); // >= 2 since it includes the top and bottom terminator
1516  tetraphilia_assert( m_numEdgeInsertionDeletions <= m_numEdges + 2 ); // +2 for front and end terminator records
1517  // sort (by increasing y value) the insertion/removal/replacement edge changes we initialized above
1518  tetraphilia::qsort( t4::get_ptr( m_edge_insertion_deletion_buffer ), m_numEdgeInsertionDeletions, sizeof(m_edge_insertion_deletion_buffer[0]), nullptr, edge_insertion_deletion_change_type::compareInsertionDeletionChanges );
1519 
1520  // set y components of m_nonZeroBounds assuming we have at least one edge change and not simply the terminator (x components were computed above)
1521  if ( m_numEdgeInsertionDeletions > 2 ) {
1522  if ( m_numActiveEdges == 0 )
1523  set_ymin(m_nonZeroBounds, real_services::FloorToInt(ArgType<int_type>(), m_edge_insertion_deletion_buffer[1].m_yVal));
1524 
1525  int_type maxYValueOfEdgeChanges = real_services::CeilToInt(ArgType<int_type>(), m_edge_insertion_deletion_buffer[m_numEdgeInsertionDeletions - 2].m_yVal);
1526  // may have already set ymax of m_nonZeroBounds to something larger than maxYValueOfEdgeChanges if there are edges which dip below the constraints
1527  if ( get_ymax(m_nonZeroBounds) < maxYValueOfEdgeChanges )
1528  set_ymax(m_nonZeroBounds, maxYValueOfEdgeChanges);
1529  }
1530 
1531  tetraphilia_assert( RectIsEmpty( constraints.m_interestBounds ) || constraints.m_bufferXMin <= get_xmin(constraints.m_interestBounds) );
1532  tetraphilia_assert( RectIsEmpty( constraints.m_interestBounds ) || constraints.m_bufferXMax >= get_xmax(constraints.m_interestBounds) );
1533 
1534  // currently we only store an x=0 based pointer to the pixel buffer, and don't bother storing the actual allocated pointer
1535  m_allocatedBuffer = t4::make_brief_array<real_type>( static_cast<size_t>( constraints.m_bufferXMax - constraints.m_bufferXMin ) );
1536  m_pixelBuffer = &t4::get_ptr( m_allocatedBuffer )[-constraints.m_bufferXMin]; // m_pixelBuffer is stored as pointer based at x=0
1537 
1538  m_nonZeroBounds = RectIntersect( m_nonZeroBounds, m_constraints.m_interestBounds ); // clip nzbounds to constraints
1539  int_type nzBoundsTop = get_ymin(m_nonZeroBounds);
1540 // size_t numInitialEdgeChangeRecords = m_numEdgeInsertionDeletions; // >= 2 since this value includes the 2 terminators
1541 
1542  m_curEdgeInsertionDeletion = &m_edge_insertion_deletion_buffer[1];
1543 
1544  // Process all edge changes above nonZeroBounds
1545  m_curScanLine = nzBoundsTop;
1546 
1547  // all the (insertion) edge changes above nzBoundsTop have already effectively been processed by the population of m_edgeSorts
1548  tetraphilia_assert( RectIsEmpty(m_nonZeroBounds) ||
1549  (!IntegerToRealConversion<int_type, real_type>::ConversionToRealWillOverflow( nzBoundsTop ) && m_curEdgeInsertionDeletion[0].m_yVal >= nzBoundsTop) );
1550 
1551  if ( m_numActiveEdges ) {
1552  // Activate any edges in m_edgeSorts
1553  for (int i = 0; i < m_numActiveEdges; ++i) {
1554  tetraphilia_assert( m_edgeSorts[i] != nullptr );
1555  tetraphilia_assert( !m_edgeSorts[i]->hasBeenActivated );
1556  InitializeEdgeToTopOfScanLine( m_edgeSorts[i], m_curScanLine );
1557  }
1558 
1559  SortActiveEdges();
1560  }
1561 
1562 #ifdef PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER
1563  app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type end_ctor_time = app_traits::context_type::current_time();
1564  m_time_spent_in_sampler_ctor = end_ctor_time - start_ctor_time;
1565 #endif
1566 }
1567 
1568 template<typename app_traits>
1569 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::SortActiveEdges()
1570 {
1571  // sort active edges
1572  tetraphilia::qsort( t4::get_ptr( m_edgeSorts ), static_cast<size_t>( m_numActiveEdges ), sizeof(m_edgeSorts[0]), nullptr, edge_type::compareBandTops );
1573 
1574  // set edgeSortsIndex and curWindingToRightOfEdge for active edges
1575  int prevWindingNumberToRightOfEdge = 0;
1576  for (int i = 0; i < m_numActiveEdges; ++i) {
1577  edge_type* edge = m_edgeSorts[i];
1578  tetraphilia_assert( edge != nullptr );
1579  active_edge_type *active = edge->activeData;
1580  tetraphilia_assert(active);
1581  active->edgeSortsIndex = i;
1582  active->curWindingToRightOfEdge = prevWindingNumberToRightOfEdge + edge->windingNum;
1583  prevWindingNumberToRightOfEdge = active->curWindingToRightOfEdge;
1584  }
1585 }
1586 
1587 template<typename app_traits>
1588 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::NewEdge( const point_type& p0,
1589  const point_type& p1,
1590  const point_type& p2,
1591  const point_type& p3,
1592  bool isLine )
1593 {
1594  /* get a version of the points that is top to bottom where top is ymin
1595  and bot is ymax
1596  */
1597  point_type top, bot, ctop, cbot;
1598  signed char windingNum;
1599 
1600  if ( get_y( p0 ) < get_y( p3 ) ) {
1601  top = p0;
1602  ctop = p1;
1603  cbot = p2;
1604  bot = p3;
1605  windingNum = 1;
1606  } else {
1607  top = p3;
1608  ctop = p2;
1609  cbot = p1;
1610  bot = p0;
1611  windingNum = -1;
1612  }
1613 
1614  // nothing to do on completely horizontal segments, or segments that
1615  // are vertically outside the clip
1616  if ( get_y( top ) == get_y( bot ) // monotone ==> horizontal line segment iff top_y = bot_y
1617  || get_y( top ) >= get_ymax( m_constraints.m_interestBounds )
1618  || get_y( bot ) <= get_ymin( m_constraints.m_interestBounds ) )
1619  return;
1620 
1621  if ( !isLine ) {
1622  // Optimization: Curve edges which are easily seen to be to the left or right of the
1623  // constraints get marked as lines since they won't draw anyway.
1624  if ( (get_x( top ) <= get_xmin( m_constraints.m_interestBounds ) && get_x( bot ) <= get_xmin( m_constraints.m_interestBounds)) ||
1625  (get_x( top ) >= get_xmax( m_constraints.m_interestBounds ) && get_x( bot ) >= get_xmax( m_constraints.m_interestBounds)) )
1626  isLine = true;
1627  // Optimization: If x value of curve is constant then since we know it is y-monotonic it must be a line segment between the top and bot points.
1628  if ( get_x( top ) == get_x( bot ) )
1629  isLine = true;
1630  }
1631 
1632  // treat lines with very large height or width as curves
1633  if ( isLine && (DifferenceIsTooLargeForLines<real_type>::Check(get_y(bot), get_y(top)) || DifferenceIsTooLargeForLines<real_type>::Check(get_x(bot), get_x(top))) )
1634  isLine = false;
1635 
1636  // allocate the new edge record
1637  auto edge = t4::make_brief<edge_type>();
1638  if ( !m_firstEdge )
1639  m_firstEdge = edge;
1640  edge->isFirstOfYMinPair = false;
1641  edge->isFirstOfYMaxPair = false;
1642 #ifdef SET_X_FROM_INTERSECTIONS
1643  edge->xSetFromIntersection = false;
1644 #endif
1645  edge->hasBeenActivated = false;
1646  edge->activeData = nullptr;
1647 
1648  edge->nextEdge = {};
1649  if ( m_lastEdge ) {
1650  m_lastEdge->nextEdge = edge;
1651 
1652  if ( m_firstEdgeOfContour ) {
1653  // here we know that we are an edge other than the first
1654  // edge of a contour, in otherwords, m_lastEdge is the
1655  // previous edge in this contour
1656 
1657  // if edge goes "up" (decreases in y from p0 to p3), then
1658  // edge's belowEdge is either the previous edge (if that
1659  // one also goes up) or zero (if that one goes down).
1660  //
1661  // however, if edge goes down, while we can set the belowEdge
1662  // of the previous edge if it also went down, we will have to wait until
1663  // we process the next edge to figure out what the current edge's belowEdge
1664  // value should be because it may need to be the value of the
1665  // next edge to be allocated
1666  //
1667  if ( windingNum < 0 ) {
1668  if ( m_lastEdge->windingNum < 0 ) {
1669  // previous and current edge both going "up"
1670  edge->belowEdge = m_lastEdge;
1671 
1672  // Usually, the bottom of the current edge and the top of m_lastEdge
1673  // will be the same here (they should ALWAYS have the same y value).
1674  // If they are not the same point then we need to allocate an extra spot in
1675  // the m_edgeSorts list for when this transition happens.
1676  tetraphilia_assert( get_y(m_lastEdge->top()) == get_y(bot) );
1677  if ( get_x(m_lastEdge->top()) != get_x(bot) )
1678  ++m_edgeSortsArraySize;
1679  }
1680  else {
1681  // previous edge going "down", current edge going "up"
1682  edge->belowEdge = {};
1683  m_lastEdge->belowEdge = {};
1684  m_lastEdge->isFirstOfYMaxPair = true;
1685  }
1686  }
1687  else {
1688  if ( m_lastEdge->windingNum > 0 ) {
1689  // previous and current edge both going "down"
1690  m_lastEdge->belowEdge = edge;
1691 
1692  // Usually, the top of the current edge and the bottom of m_lastEdge
1693  // will be the same here (they should ALWAYS have the same y value).
1694  // If they are not the same point then we need to allocate an extra spot in
1695  // the m_edgeSorts list for when this transition happens.
1696  tetraphilia_assert( get_y(top) == get_y(m_lastEdge->bot()) );
1697  if ( get_x(top) != get_x(m_lastEdge->bot()) )
1698  ++m_edgeSortsArraySize;
1699  }
1700  else {
1701  // previous edge going "up", current edge going "down"
1702  m_lastEdge->isFirstOfYMinPair = true;
1703  m_edgeSortsArraySize += 2; // (we count 2 on the down edge instead of counting 1 for each the up and down edge)
1704  }
1705  }
1706  }
1707  }
1708  m_lastEdge = edge;
1709  ++m_numEdges;
1710  edge->isFirstEdgeOfContour = !m_firstEdgeOfContour;
1711  if ( edge->isFirstEdgeOfContour )
1712  m_firstEdgeOfContour = edge;
1713 
1714  edge->top() = top;
1715  edge->bot() = bot;
1716  edge->windingNum = windingNum;
1717 
1718 
1719  edge->cachedEdgeToLeft[0] = nullptr;
1720  edge->cachedEdgeToLeft[1] = nullptr;
1721 
1722 
1723  edge->isLine = isLine;
1724 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
1725  edge->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine = isLine; // for actual line edges isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine gets set here and is never changed again
1726 #endif
1727 
1728  edge->deltaX = get_x(bot) - get_x(top);
1729  edge->deltaXSign = (get_x(bot) > get_x(top)) ? 1 : ((get_x(bot) < get_x(top)) ? -1 : 0);
1730 
1731  if ( isLine ) {
1732  real_type height = get_y(bot) - get_y(top);
1733  tetraphilia_assert( height != 0 ); // may start supporting horizontal edges for thin stroking someday so this may need to be modified to protect the division below
1734  // For fixed point builds we sometimes shift the reciprocal height to preserve precision
1735  PrecisionGuardian<real_type>::SetDeltaYInverseAndBitShiftBasedOnHeight( edge->deltaYInverse, edge->deltaYInverseShift, height );
1736  }
1737  else {
1738 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
1739  edge->d_x = get_x(top);
1740  edge->d_y = get_y(top);
1741  edge->c_x = get_x(ctop) - get_x(top);
1742  edge->c_y = get_y(ctop) - get_y(top);
1743  edge->b_x = get_x(cbot) - get_x(ctop) - edge->c_x;
1744  edge->b_y = get_y(cbot) - get_y(ctop) - edge->c_y;
1745  edge->a_x = get_x(bot) - 3 * (get_x(cbot) - get_x(ctop)) - edge->d_x;
1746  edge->a_y = get_y(bot) - 3 * (get_y(cbot) - get_y(ctop)) - edge->d_y;
1747 #endif
1748 
1749  #ifdef USE_PRECOMPUTED_CURVATURE_DATA_1
1750  edge->vxa[0] = 6 * (edge->b_x * edge->a_y - edge->a_x * edge->b_y);
1751  edge->vxa[1] = 6 * (edge->c_x * edge->a_y - edge->a_x * edge->c_y);
1752  edge->vxa[2] = 2 * (edge->c_x * edge->b_y - edge->b_x * edge->c_y);
1753  #endif
1754 
1755  edge->ctop() = ctop;
1756  edge->cbot() = cbot;
1757 
1758  // this information was previously computed in the 1D bezier partitioning, so
1759  // right now we're computing it twice in this case
1760 
1761  edge->xCubicBernsteinPoly.Set( get_x(top), get_x(ctop), get_x(cbot), get_x(bot) );
1762  edge->yCubicBernsteinPoly.Set( get_y(top), get_y(ctop), get_y(cbot), get_y(bot) );
1763  }
1764 
1765  #if defined(_DEBUG) && !(defined(__arm__) || defined(__SYMBIAN32__))
1766  edge->id = edge_type::globalID++;
1767  #endif
1768 }
1769 
1770 template<typename app_traits>
1771 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::MakeActiveEdge( edge_type *edge )
1772 {
1773  // initially always activate the edge
1774  active_edge_type* active = m_activeEdgePool.malloc();
1775 
1776  // boost::object_pool returns null instead of throwing on failure
1777  if ( !active )
1778  throw std::bad_alloc();
1779 
1780  edge->activeData = active;
1781 
1782  #ifdef _DEBUG
1783  active->edgeSortsIndex = -1;
1784  #endif
1785 
1786  active->slipBezBufferPtr = nullptr;
1787  active->crossingXBufferPtr = nullptr;
1788 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
1789  active->crossingTBufferPtr = 0;
1790 #endif
1791  active->curSplit = &edge->top();
1792 
1793  // by setting to reverse values they can never have simultaneously
1794  active->curYLocalControlPointsTop = 1;
1795  active->curYLocalControlPointsBot = 0;
1796 }
1797 
1798 template<typename app_traits>
1799 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::ClearActiveEdge( edge_type *edge )
1800 {
1801  if (edge->activeData)
1802  {
1803  if ( edge->activeData->slipBezBufferPtr != nullptr )
1804  m_splitBufPool.free(edge->activeData->slipBezBufferPtr);
1805  if ( edge->activeData->crossingXBufferPtr != nullptr )
1806  m_crossingBufPool.free(static_cast<crossing_buf_type*>(edge->activeData->crossingXBufferPtr));
1807 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
1808  if ( edge->activeData->crossingTBufferPtr != 0 )
1809  m_crossingBufPool.free(static_cast<crossing_buf_type*>(edge->activeData->crossingTBufferPtr));
1810 #endif
1811 
1812  m_activeEdgePool.free(edge->activeData);
1813  edge->activeData = nullptr;
1814  edge->hasBeenActivated = false;
1815  }
1816 }
1817 
1818 
1819 template<typename app_traits>
1820 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::NewCurveEdge(
1821  const point_type& p0, const point_type& p1,
1822  const point_type& p2, const point_type& p3 )
1823 {
1824  if ( (p1 == p0 || p1 == p3) && (p2 == p3 || p2 == p0) )
1825  {
1826  NewLineEdge( p0, p3 );
1827  }
1828  else
1829  {
1830  // If bbox of control points is at least max_real/4 in either dimension then split and recurse.
1831  // This ensures that the derivative computation in BezGetMonotoneSections() will not overflow when computing the coefficients of the derivative.
1832  real_type Max_delta = real_services::DivideBy4( limits<real_type>::max() );
1833  real_type SafeMinSize = 3 * Max_delta;
1834  real_type mx = t4::min<real_type>( get_x(p0), get_x(p1), get_x(p2), get_x(p3) );
1835  real_type Mx = t4::max<real_type>( get_x(p0), get_x(p1), get_x(p2), get_x(p3) );
1836  real_type my = t4::min<real_type>( get_y(p0), get_y(p1), get_y(p2), get_y(p3) );
1837  real_type My = t4::max<real_type>( get_y(p0), get_y(p1), get_y(p2), get_y(p3) );
1838 
1839  if ( (Mx > mx + Max_delta && mx <= SafeMinSize) || (My > my + Max_delta && my <= SafeMinSize) )
1840  {
1841  // split and recurse for super-large edges which can cause overflow problems.
1842  point_type splitBez[ 2 * NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT ];
1843  splitBez[NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT] = p0;
1844  splitBez[NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT+1] = p1;
1845  splitBez[NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT+2] = p2;
1846  splitBez[NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT+3] = p3;
1847 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
1848  // set t value info merely to prevent any problems in splitPtrlBez
1849  tetraphilia_assert( NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT == 5 );
1850  get_x(splitBez[9]) = 0; // start t
1851  get_y(splitBez[9]) = 1; // t length
1852 #endif
1853 
1854  SplitPrtlBez( &splitBez[NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT] );
1855 
1856  NewCurveEdge( splitBez[0], splitBez[1], splitBez[2], splitBez[3] );
1857  NewCurveEdge( splitBez[NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT],
1858  splitBez[NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT+1],
1859  splitBez[NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT+2],
1860  splitBez[NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT+3] );
1861  }
1862  else
1863  {
1864  point_type monotonePts[16];
1865  size_t numSections = BezGetMonotoneSections(monotonePts, p0, p1, p2, p3);
1866  tetraphilia_assert(numSections <= 5);
1867 
1868  point_type* curPos = monotonePts;
1869  for ( size_t section = 0; section < numSections; section++ )
1870  {
1871  //tetraphilia_assert( BezIsMonotoneInXAndY( curPos ) );
1872  NewEdge(curPos[0], curPos[1], curPos[2], curPos[3], curPos[0] == curPos[1] && curPos[2] == curPos[3]);
1873  curPos += 3;
1874  }
1875  }
1876  }
1877 }
1878 
1879 template<typename app_traits>
1880 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::ComputeCrossingTable( edge_type* edge )
1881 {
1882  real_type biggestGap = TETRAPHILIA_STATIC_TYPENAME_REAL( real_type, 1.0 );
1883  size_t numSteps;
1884 
1885  active_edge_type *active = edge->activeData;
1886 
1887  // this function is only called for curves
1888  tetraphilia_assert( !edge->isLine );
1889 
1890  tetraphilia_assert( active->firstCall || active->curSplit < &(*active->slipBezBufferPtr)[0] + active->slipBezBufferPtr->size() );
1891 
1892  // if this is not the first time this routine has been called for this edge, then
1893  // copy the last x and t entries from last time into the first entries for this time
1894  if ( !active->firstCall ) {
1895  (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[0] = (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[ static_cast<size_t>( active->crossingBuffBotY-active->crossingBuffTopY ) ];
1896 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
1897  active->crossingTBufferPtr[0] = active->crossingTBufferPtr[active->crossingBuffBotY-active->crossingBuffTopY];
1898 #endif
1899  }
1900 
1901  // continue to split this bezier in half until we get
1902  // a piece that is small enough to forward difference
1903  // without too much round off error, or until we run
1904  // out of space in our bezier buff
1905  while ( ( active->firstCall || active->curSplit != &(*active->slipBezBufferPtr)[0] )
1906  && MustSplitPrtlBez( active->curSplit, biggestGap ) ) {
1907 
1908  if ( active->slipBezBufferPtr == nullptr ) {
1909  active->slipBezBufferPtr = m_splitBufPool.malloc();
1910  active->curSplit = &(*active->slipBezBufferPtr)[(kSplitBezBuffSize-1) * NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT];
1911  active->curSplit[0] = edge->top();
1912  active->curSplit[1] = edge->ctop();
1913  active->curSplit[2] = edge->cbot();
1914  active->curSplit[3] = edge->bot();
1915 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
1916  get_x(active->curSplit[4]) = 0;
1917  get_y(active->curSplit[4]) = 1;
1918 #endif
1919  }
1920  tetraphilia_assert( active->slipBezBufferPtr != nullptr );
1921 
1922  //tetraphilia_assert( BezIsMonotoneInXAndIncreasingInY( active->curSplit ) );
1923  active->curSplit = SplitPrtlBez( active->curSplit );
1924 
1925  //tetraphilia_assert( BezIsMonotoneInXAndIncreasingInY( active->curSplit ) );
1926  //tetraphilia_assert( BezIsMonotoneInXAndIncreasingInY( &active->curSplit[NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT] ) );
1927 
1928  if ( get_y(active->curSplit[3]) <= get_ymin(m_constraints.m_interestBounds) )
1929  active->curSplit += NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT;
1930  }
1931 
1932  bool isLastCall = active->slipBezBufferPtr == nullptr || active->curSplit == &(*active->slipBezBufferPtr)[(kSplitBezBuffSize-1) * NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT];
1933 
1934  tetraphilia_assert( real_services::CeilToInt(ArgType<int_type>(), get_y(active->curSplit[3])) - real_services::FloorToInt(ArgType<int_type>(), get_y(active->curSplit[0])) <= forward_difference_limit<real_type>::kMaxSteps );
1935
