1936  // get the number of forward differencing steps required so that
1937  // no y step will be farther than kMaxSampleDist.
1938  numSteps = GetNumPrtlBezSteps( biggestGap );
1939 
1940  // these two FillBezTable calls will put numSteps+1 values into the
1941  // xValBuf and yValBuf tables
1942 
1943  // fill out the x table
1944  FillBezTable( get_x(active->curSplit[0]), get_x(active->curSplit[1]),
1945  get_x(active->curSplit[2]), get_x(active->curSplit[3]),
1946  numSteps, m_xValBuff
1947 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
1948  , m_xtValBuff, get_x(active->curSplit[4]), get_y(active->curSplit[4])
1949 #endif
1950  );
1951 
1952  // fill out the y table
1953  call_YFill<real_type, int_type>::Fill(
1954  get_y(active->curSplit[0]), get_y(active->curSplit[1]),
1955  get_y(active->curSplit[2]), get_y(active->curSplit[3]),
1956  numSteps, m_yValBuff
1957  #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
1958  , m_ytValBuff, get_x(active->curSplit[4]), get_y(active->curSplit[4])
1959  #endif
1960  );
1961 
1962  // fill out the crossing table (x values where the edge enters each scanline)
1963 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
1964  FillYCrossingTable<app_traits, int_type>( m_context, &active->crossingXBufferPtr[1], &active->crossingTBufferPtr[1],
1965  edge->xCubicBernsteinPoly, edge->yCubicBernsteinPoly,
1966  m_yValBuff, m_ytValBuff, numSteps );
1967 #else
1968  FillYCrossingTable<app_traits, int_type>( GetGlobalContext(), &(*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[1], m_xValBuff, m_yValBuff, numSteps );
1969 #endif
1970 
1971  active->crossingBuffTopY = real_services::FloorToInt( ArgType<int_type>(), get_y(active->curSplit[0]) );
1972  tetraphilia_assert( active->firstCall || active->crossingBuffTopY == active->crossingBuffBotY ); // I think this should hold true. If not we may have a problem.
1973  active->crossingBuffBotY = real_services::FloorToInt( ArgType<int_type>(), get_y(active->curSplit[3]) );
1974 
1975 #ifdef TETRAPHILIA_SUPPORT_REDUCER_PRECISION_ASSERT
1976  {
1977  // assert crossing points are in expected range
1978  real_type xmin = t4::min<real_type>( get_x(edge->top()), get_x(edge->bot()) );
1979  real_type xmax = t4::max<real_type>( get_x(edge->top()), get_x(edge->bot()) );
1980  for ( int_type i = active->firstCall ? 1 : 0; i <= active->crossingBuffBotY - active->crossingBuffTopY; ++i ) {
1981  if ( (i != 0 || active->crossingBuffTopY > get_y(edge->top())) && (i != active->crossingBuffBotY - active->crossingBuffTopY || active->crossingBuffBotY <= get_y(edge->bot())) ) {
1982  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( xmin - 0.01 <= (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[i] && (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[i] <= xmax + 0.01 );
1983  }
1984  }
1985  }
1986 #endif
1987 
1988  // extrapolate the first and/or last scan line entries if this is the beginning or end of the edge
1989  if ( active->firstCall || isLastCall ) {
1990  if ( active->firstCall ) {
1991  if ( active->crossingBuffBotY == active->crossingBuffTopY ) {
1992  // degen case for firstCall
1993 #ifndef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
1994  real_type deltaX = get_x(active->curSplit[3]) - get_x(active->curSplit[0]);
1995  real_type deltaY = get_y(active->curSplit[3]) - get_y(active->curSplit[0]);
1996  real_type invSlope = deltaX / deltaY;
1997  (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[0] = get_x(active->curSplit[0]) - real_services::Fraction(get_y(active->curSplit[0])) * invSlope;
1998 #else
1999  // bkaskel: TODO: does setting the crossing to the endpoint x value mess up the "isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine" case? Should we extrapolate here too for that case?
2000  (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[0] = get_x(active->curSplit[0]);
2001  active->crossingTBufferPtr[0] = 0;
2002  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x(edge->top()) <= (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[0] && (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[0] <= get_x(edge->bot())) ||
2003  (get_x(edge->top()) >= (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[0] && (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[0] >= get_x(edge->bot())) );
2004 #endif
2005  } else {
2006  // normal case for firstCall
2007 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
2008  // bkaskel: TODO: does setting the crossing to the endpoint x value mess up the "isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine" case? Should we extrapolate here too for that case?
2009  (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[0] = get_x(active->curSplit[0]);
2010  active->crossingTBufferPtr[0] = 0;
2011  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x(edge->top()) <= (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[0] && (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[0] <= get_x(edge->bot())) ||
2012  (get_x(edge->top()) >= (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[0] && (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[0] >= get_x(edge->bot())) );
2013 #else
2014  real_type deltaX = (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[1] - get_x(active->curSplit[0]);
2015  real_type deltaY = 1 - real_services::Fraction(get_y(active->curSplit[0]));
2016  real_type invSlope = deltaX / deltaY;
2017  (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[0] = get_x(active->curSplit[0]) - (1-deltaY) * invSlope;
2018 #endif
2019  }
2020  }
2021  if ( isLastCall ) {
2022 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
2023  // bkaskel: TODO: does setting the crossing to the endpoint x value mess up the "isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine" case? Should we extrapolate here too for that case?
2024  (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[1+active->crossingBuffBotY-active->crossingBuffTopY] = get_x(active->curSplit[3]);
2025  active->crossingTBufferPtr[1+active->crossingBuffBotY-active->crossingBuffTopY] = 1;
2026  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x(edge->top()) <= (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[1+active->crossingBuffBotY-active->crossingBuffTopY] && (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[1+active->crossingBuffBotY-active->crossingBuffTopY] <= get_x(edge->bot())) ||
2027  (get_x(edge->top()) >= (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[1+active->crossingBuffBotY-active->crossingBuffTopY] && (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[1+active->crossingBuffBotY-active->crossingBuffTopY] >= get_x(edge->bot())) );
2028 #else
2029  real_type deltaX = get_x(active->curSplit[3]) - (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[ static_cast<size_t>( active->crossingBuffBotY-active->crossingBuffTopY ) ];
2030  real_type deltaY = real_services::Fraction(get_y(active->curSplit[3]));
2031  if (deltaY == 0)
2032  deltaY = 1;
2033  real_type invSlope = deltaX / deltaY;
2034  (*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[static_cast<size_t>( 1+active->crossingBuffBotY-active->crossingBuffTopY )] = get_x(active->curSplit[3]) + (1-deltaY) * invSlope;
2035 #endif
2036  ++active->crossingBuffBotY;
2037  }
2038  }
2039 
2040  active->firstCall = false;
2041  active->curSplit += NUM_POINTS_STORED_PER_SPLIT; // this should be safe even if curSplit == edge->top() since we should not call this again.
2042 }
2043 
2044 
2045 template<typename app_traits>
2046 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::getXAndTValuesForYValue( edge_type* edge, real_type yVal, real_type& xVal
2047 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
2048  , real_type& tVal
2049 #endif
2050  )
2051 {
2052  tetraphilia_assert( m_curScanLine <= yVal && yVal <= m_curScanLine + 1 ); // the uses of curXCross / curTCross below depends on this
2053  tetraphilia_assert( !edge->isLine ); // currently not using this method for lines, only for curves
2054 
2055 #if defined(PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER) && PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER >= 2
2056  ++m_callsTo_getXAndTValuesForYValue;
2057  //char buf[1024];
2058  //sprintf( buf, "yVal = %f edge=0x%08p %s\n", yVal, edge, edge->yVal != yVal ? "" : "HIT");
2059  //OutputDebugString(buf);
2060 #endif
2061 
2062 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
2063  active_edge_type *active = edge->activeData;
2064  tetraphilia_assert( active != 0 );
2065  if (active->yVal != yVal) {
2066  active->yVal = yVal;
2067 
2068  #if defined(PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER) && PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER >= 2
2069  ++m_cacheMissesFor_getXAndTValuesForYValue;
2070  #endif
2071 
2072  if ( yVal == get_y(edge->top()) ) {
2073  active->xVal = get_x(edge->top());
2074  active->tVal = 0;
2075  }
2076  else if ( yVal == get_y(edge->bot()) ) {
2077  active->xVal = get_x(edge->bot());
2078  active->tVal = real_type(1);
2079  }
2080  else
2081  {
2082  int_type scanLineForYVal = real_services::FloorToInt( ArgType<int_type>(), yVal );
2083  tetraphilia_assert( active->crossingBuffBotY >= scanLineForYVal + 1 );
2084 // while ( active->crossingBuffBotY < scanLineForYVal + 1 )
2085 // ComputeCrossingTable( edge ); // bkaskel: TODO: this screws up the curT pointers! if we hit it here!!!
2086  tetraphilia_assert( scanLineForYVal - active->crossingBuffTopY >= 0 && scanLineForYVal <= active->crossingBuffBotY );
2087  real_type* curTCross = &active->crossingTBufferPtr[scanLineForYVal - active->crossingBuffTopY];
2088 
2089  #if defined(PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER) && PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER >= 2
2090  app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type start_Inverse_time = app_traits::context_type::current_time();
2091  #endif
2092 
2093  active->tVal = Inverse( edge->yCubicBernsteinPoly, yVal, curTCross[0], curTCross[1] );
2094 
2095  #if defined(PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER) && PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER >= 2
2096  app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type end_Inverse_time = app_traits::context_type::current_time();
2097  m_time_spent_in_Inverse_in_getXAndTValuesForYValue += end_Inverse_time - start_Inverse_time;
2098  ++m_numTimesInverse_in_getXAndTValuesForYValueWasCalled;
2099  #endif
2100  active->xVal = Eval( edge->xCubicBernsteinPoly, active->tVal );
2101  }
2102  }
2103  xVal = active->xVal;
2104  tVal = active->tVal;
2105 #else
2106 
2107  int_type scanLineForYVal = real_services::FloorToInt( ArgType<int_type>(), yVal );
2108  int_type belowScanLineForYVal = scanLineForYVal + 1;
2109  active_edge_type *active = edge->activeData;
2110  while ( active->crossingBuffBotY < belowScanLineForYVal )
2111  ComputeCrossingTable( edge );
2112  tetraphilia_assert( scanLineForYVal - active->crossingBuffTopY >= 0 );
2113 
2114  tetraphilia_assert( get_y(edge->top()) < belowScanLineForYVal );
2115 
2116  if ( yVal == get_y(edge->bot()) )
2117  xVal = get_x(edge->bot());
2118  else {
2119  auto curXCross = &(*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[ static_cast<size_t>( scanLineForYVal - active->crossingBuffTopY ) ];
2120  point_type lineSegTop;
2121  point_type lineSegBot;
2122  bool divisionRequired = false;
2123 
2124  if ( get_y(edge->top()) >= scanLineForYVal ) {
2125  lineSegTop = edge->top();
2126  divisionRequired = true;
2127  }
2128  else {
2129  get_x( lineSegTop ) = curXCross[0];
2130  get_y( lineSegTop ) = real_type(scanLineForYVal);
2131  }
2132  if ( get_y(edge->bot()) <= belowScanLineForYVal ) {
2133  lineSegBot = edge->bot();
2134  divisionRequired = true;
2135  }
2136  else {
2137  get_x( lineSegBot ) = curXCross[1];
2138  get_y( lineSegBot ) = real_type(belowScanLineForYVal);
2139  }
2140 
2141  real_type frac = yVal - get_y(lineSegTop);
2142  if ( divisionRequired )
2143  frac /= get_y(lineSegBot) - get_y(lineSegTop);
2144  xVal = get_x(lineSegTop) + (get_x(lineSegBot) - get_x(lineSegTop)) * frac;
2145  }
2146 #endif
2147 }
2148 
2149 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
2150 template<typename app_traits>
2151 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::InitLocalBezierObject( edge_type* edge, BezierSegment<point_type>& seg, real_type yBandMin, real_type yBandMax, bool transposedXandYAndEnsureYIsIncreasing )
2152 {
2153  active_edge_type *active = edge->activeData;
2154  tetraphilia_assert( active && !active->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine );
2155 
2156  if ( active->curYLocalControlPointsTop != yBandMin || active->curYLocalControlPointsBot != yBandMax ) {
2157 
2158  active->curYLocalControlPointsTop = yBandMin;
2159  active->curYLocalControlPointsBot = yBandMax;
2160 
2161  get_x(active->localControlPoint[0]) = active->curXBandTop;
2162  get_y(active->localControlPoint[0]) = yBandMin;
2163 
2164  get_x(active->localControlPoint[3]) = active->curXBandBot;
2165  get_y(active->localControlPoint[3]) = yBandMax;
2166 
2167  const real_type& t1 = active->curTBandTop;
2168  const real_type& t2 = active->curTBandBot;
2169 
2170  //tetraphilia_assert( t1 >= 0 && t1 < 1 ); // seems to hold in floating point builds but definitely can fail for fixed point builds
2171  //tetraphilia_assert( t2 > 0 && t2 <= 1 ); // seems to hold in floating point builds but definitely can fail for fixed point builds
2172  // replacing two above asserts with these two
2173  tetraphilia_assert( t1 >= 0 && t1 <= 1 ); // seems to hold in floating point builds but definitely can fail for fixed point builds
2174  tetraphilia_assert( t2 >= 0 && t2 <= 1 ); // seems to hold in floating point builds but definitely can fail for fixed point builds
2175 
2176  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( AbsVal(active->curXBandTop - (((edge->a_x * t1 + 3 * edge->b_x) * t1 + 3 * edge->c_x) * t1 + edge->d_x)) <= 0.016); // 0.002 seems to suffice for floating point builds.
2177  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( AbsVal(yBandMin - (((edge->a_y * t1 + 3 * edge->b_y) * t1 + 3 * edge->c_y) * t1 + edge->d_y)) <= 0.001);
2178  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( t1 > 0 || active->localControlPoint[0] == edge->top() ); // seems to hold for floating point builds, but for fixed point builds can fail when y deriv is large at endpoint
2179  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( AbsVal(active->curXBandBot - (((edge->a_x * t2 + 3 * edge->b_x) * t2 + 3 * edge->c_x) * t2 + edge->d_x)) <= 0.016); // 0.002 seems to suffice for floating point builds.
2180  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( AbsVal(yBandMax - (((edge->a_y * t2 + 3 * edge->b_y) * t2 + 3 * edge->c_y) * t2 + edge->d_y)) <= 0.001);
2181  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( t2 < 1 || active->localControlPoint[3] == edge->bot() ); // seems to hold for floating point builds, but for fixed point builds can fail when deriv is large at endpoint
2182 
2183  get_y(active->localControlPoint[1]) = ((edge->a_y * t1 + 2 * edge->b_y) * t1 + edge->c_y) * t2 + (edge->b_y * t1 + 2 * edge->c_y) * t1 + edge->d_y;
2184  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( get_y(active->localControlPoint[1]) + 0.012 >= get_y(active->localControlPoint[0]) ); // 0.001 seems to suffice for floating point builds
2185  if ( get_y(active->localControlPoint[1]) < get_y(active->localControlPoint[0]) )
2186  get_y(active->localControlPoint[1]) = get_y(active->localControlPoint[0]);
2187 
2188  get_y(active->localControlPoint[2]) = ((edge->a_y * t2 + 2 * edge->b_y) * t2 + edge->c_y) * t1 + (edge->b_y * t2 + 2 * edge->c_y) * t2 + edge->d_y;
2189  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( get_y(active->localControlPoint[2]) - 0.012 <= get_y(active->localControlPoint[3]) ); // 0.001 seems to suffice for floating point builds
2190  if ( get_y(active->localControlPoint[2]) > get_y(active->localControlPoint[3]) )
2191  get_y(active->localControlPoint[2]) = get_y(active->localControlPoint[3]);
2192 
2193  #if defined(PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER) && PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER >= 2
2194 // app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type
2195  start_Inverse_time = app_traits::context_type::current_time();
2196  #endif
2197  real_type localDeltaVal = get_x(active->localControlPoint[3]) - get_x(active->localControlPoint[0]);
2198  if ( localDeltaVal != 0 ) {
2199  get_x(active->localControlPoint[1]) = ((edge->a_x * t1 + 2 * edge->b_x) * t1 + edge->c_x) * t2 + (edge->b_x * t1 + 2 * edge->c_x) * t1 + edge->d_x;
2200  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( (edge->deltaXSign < 0) || (get_x(active->localControlPoint[1]) + 0.160 >= get_x(active->localControlPoint[0])) ); // 0.001 seems to suffice for floating point builds
2201  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( (edge->deltaXSign > 0) || (get_x(active->localControlPoint[1]) - 0.160 <= get_x(active->localControlPoint[0])) ); // 0.001 seems to suffice for floating point builds
2202  if ( ProductIsLessThanZeroOrPossiblyZero( localDeltaVal, (get_x(active->localControlPoint[1]) - get_x(active->localControlPoint[0])) ) )
2203  get_x(active->localControlPoint[1]) = get_x(active->localControlPoint[0]);
2204 
2205  get_x(active->localControlPoint[2]) = ((edge->a_x * t2 + 2 * edge->b_x) * t2 + edge->c_x) * t1 + (edge->b_x * t2 + 2 * edge->c_x) * t2 + edge->d_x;
2206  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( (edge->deltaXSign < 0) || (get_x(active->localControlPoint[2]) - 0.160 <= get_x(active->localControlPoint[3])) ); // 0.001 seems to suffice for floating point builds
2207  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( (edge->deltaXSign > 0) || (get_x(active->localControlPoint[2]) + 0.160 >= get_x(active->localControlPoint[3])) ); // 0.001 seems to suffice for floating point builds
2208  if ( ProductIsLessThanZeroOrPossiblyZero( localDeltaVal, (get_x(active->localControlPoint[3]) - get_x(active->localControlPoint[2])) ) )
2209  get_x(active->localControlPoint[2]) = get_x(active->localControlPoint[3]);
2210 
2211  tetraphilia_assert( get_y(active->localControlPoint[0]) <= get_y(active->localControlPoint[1]) && get_y(active->localControlPoint[2]) <= get_y(active->localControlPoint[3]) );
2212  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x(active->localControlPoint[0]) <= get_x(active->localControlPoint[1]) && get_x(active->localControlPoint[2]) <= get_x(active->localControlPoint[3])) ||
2213  (get_x(active->localControlPoint[3]) <= get_x(active->localControlPoint[2]) && get_x(active->localControlPoint[1]) <= get_x(active->localControlPoint[0])) );
2214  }
2215  else
2216  get_x(active->localControlPoint[1]) = get_x(active->localControlPoint[2]) = get_x(active->localControlPoint[0]);
2217  #if defined(PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER) && PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER >= 2
2218  //app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type
2219  end_Inverse_time = app_traits::context_type::current_time();
2220  m_time_spent_in_probe2 += end_Inverse_time - start_Inverse_time - 44;
2221  ++m_num_probe2;
2222  #endif
2223  }
2224 
2225  tetraphilia_assert( get_y( edge->top() ) <= get_y(active->localControlPoint[0]) && get_y(active->localControlPoint[0]) <= get_y( edge->bot() ) );
2226  tetraphilia_assert( get_y( edge->top() ) <= get_y(active->localControlPoint[1]) );
2227  tetraphilia_assert( get_y(active->localControlPoint[2]) <= get_y( edge->bot() ) );
2228  tetraphilia_assert( get_y( edge->top() ) <= get_y(active->localControlPoint[3]) && get_y(active->localControlPoint[3]) <= get_y( edge->bot() ) );
2229  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x( edge->top() ) <= get_x(active->localControlPoint[0]) && get_x(active->localControlPoint[0]) <= get_x( edge->bot() )) ||
2230  (get_x( edge->bot() ) <= get_x(active->localControlPoint[0]) && get_x(active->localControlPoint[0]) <= get_x( edge->top() )) );
2231  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x( edge->top() ) <= get_x( edge->bot() ) && get_x( edge->top() ) <= get_x(active->localControlPoint[1]) ) ||
2232  (get_x( edge->bot() ) <= get_x( edge->top() ) && get_x( edge->top() ) >= get_x(active->localControlPoint[1]) ) );
2233  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x( edge->top() ) <= get_x( edge->bot() ) && get_x( edge->bot() ) >= get_x(active->localControlPoint[2]) ) ||
2234  (get_x( edge->bot() ) <= get_x( edge->top() ) && get_x( edge->bot() ) <= get_x(active->localControlPoint[2]) ) );
2235  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x( edge->top() ) <= get_x(active->localControlPoint[3]) && get_x(active->localControlPoint[3]) <= get_x( edge->bot() )) ||
2236  (get_x( edge->bot() ) <= get_x(active->localControlPoint[3]) && get_x(active->localControlPoint[3]) <= get_x( edge->top() )) );
2237 
2238  if ( !transposedXandYAndEnsureYIsIncreasing ) {
2239  seg.controlPoint[0] = active->localControlPoint[0];
2240  seg.controlPoint[1] = active->localControlPoint[1];
2241  seg.controlPoint[2] = active->localControlPoint[2];
2242  seg.controlPoint[3] = active->localControlPoint[3];
2243  }
2244  else {
2245  if ( get_x(active->localControlPoint[0]) <= get_x(active->localControlPoint[3]) ) {
2246  get_x(seg.controlPoint[0]) = get_y(active->localControlPoint[0]);
2247  get_y(seg.controlPoint[0]) = get_x(active->localControlPoint[0]);
2248  get_x(seg.controlPoint[1]) = get_y(active->localControlPoint[1]);
2249  get_y(seg.controlPoint[1]) = get_x(active->localControlPoint[1]);
2250  get_x(seg.controlPoint[2]) = get_y(active->localControlPoint[2]);
2251  get_y(seg.controlPoint[2]) = get_x(active->localControlPoint[2]);
2252  get_x(seg.controlPoint[3]) = get_y(active->localControlPoint[3]);
2253  get_y(seg.controlPoint[3]) = get_x(active->localControlPoint[3]);
2254  } else {
2255  get_x(seg.controlPoint[0]) = get_y(active->localControlPoint[3]);
2256  get_y(seg.controlPoint[0]) = get_x(active->localControlPoint[3]);
2257  get_x(seg.controlPoint[1]) = get_y(active->localControlPoint[2]);
2258  get_y(seg.controlPoint[1]) = get_x(active->localControlPoint[2]);
2259  get_x(seg.controlPoint[2]) = get_y(active->localControlPoint[1]);
2260  get_y(seg.controlPoint[2]) = get_x(active->localControlPoint[1]);
2261  get_x(seg.controlPoint[3]) = get_y(active->localControlPoint[0]);
2262  get_y(seg.controlPoint[3]) = get_x(active->localControlPoint[0]);
2263  }
2264  }
2265 }
2266 
2267 // Computes signed area between curve and y axis
2268 //
2269 // Given a cubic bezier segment defined by control points P0=(x0,y0), P1=(x1,y1), P2=(x2,y2), P3=(x3,y3),
2270 // the signed area between the segment and the y axis can be found as follows:
2271 //
2272 // [ -1/2 3/10 3/20 1/20 ] [ x0 ] T
2273 // signed area = [y0,y1,y2,y3] [ -3/10 0 3/20 3/20 ] [ x1 ] = Y * A * X = Sum a_{i,j} x_i y_j
2274 // [ -3/20 -3/20 0 3/10 ] [ x2 ] i,j
2275 // [ -1/20 -3/20 -3/10 1/2 ] [ x3 ]
2276 //
2277 template<typename app_traits>
2278 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::ComputeSignedAreaBetweenSegmentAndYAxis( const BezierSegment<point_type>& seg, real_type& area )
2279 {
2280  //BezierAreaCoefficients[16] = { 10, 6, 3, 1, -6, 0, 3, 3, -3, -3, 0, 6, -1, -3, -6, -10 };
2281  //area = 0;
2282  //int k = 0;
2283  //for (int i = 3; i >= 0; --i)
2284  // for (int j = 3; j >= 0; --j)
2285  // area += get_y(seg.controlPoint[i]) * get_x(seg.controlPoint[j]) * BezierAreaCoefficients[k++];
2286  //area *= real_type(1.0/20);
2287 
2288  area = (get_y(seg.controlPoint[3]) * (10 * get_x(seg.controlPoint[3]) + 6 * get_x(seg.controlPoint[2]) + 3 * get_x(seg.controlPoint[1]) + get_x(seg.controlPoint[0]))
2289  - get_y(seg.controlPoint[0]) * (get_x(seg.controlPoint[3]) + 3 * get_x(seg.controlPoint[2]) + 6 * get_x(seg.controlPoint[1]) + 10 * get_x(seg.controlPoint[0]))
2290  + get_y(seg.controlPoint[2]) * (3 * (get_x(seg.controlPoint[0]) + get_x(seg.controlPoint[1])) - 6 * get_x(seg.controlPoint[3]))
2291  + get_y(seg.controlPoint[1]) * (6 * get_x(seg.controlPoint[0]) - 3 * (get_x(seg.controlPoint[2]) + get_x(seg.controlPoint[3])))) * real_type(1.0/20);
2292 }
2293 
2294 // Computes power series such that powerCoeff[0] is the t^3 term and powerCoeff[1] is the t^2 term, etc...
2295 template<typename app_traits>
2296 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::GetPowerSeriesCoefficientsFromBernsteinCoefficients( real_type a0,
2297  real_type a1,
2298  real_type a2,
2299  real_type a3,
2300  real_type* powerCoeff )
2301 {
2302  real_type p21_3 = (a2 - a1) * 3;
2303 
2304  powerCoeff[0] = a3 - p21_3 - a0;
2305  powerCoeff[2] = (a1 - a0) * 3;
2306  powerCoeff[1] = p21_3 - powerCoeff[2];
2307  powerCoeff[3] = a0;
2308 }
2309 
2310 // Computes the t value for which seg has a y-value of y.
2311 template<typename app_traits>
2312 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::InverseYOfBezierSegment( const BezierSegment<point_type>& seg, real_type y, real_type& t )
2313 {
2314  tetraphilia_assert( get_y(seg.controlPoint[0]) <= y && y <= get_y(seg.controlPoint[3]) );
2315 
2316 #if defined(PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER) && PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER >= 2
2317  app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type start_InverseYOfBezierSegment_time = app_traits::context_type::current_time();
2318 #endif
2319 
2320  if ( get_y(seg.controlPoint[0]) == y )
2321  t = 0;
2322  else if ( get_y(seg.controlPoint[3]) == y )
2323  t = 1;
2324  else {
2325  cubic_bernstein_monotone_poly_storage<real_type> yCubic;
2326  yCubic.Set( get_y(seg.controlPoint[0]), get_y(seg.controlPoint[1]), get_y(seg.controlPoint[2]), get_y(seg.controlPoint[3]) );
2327  t = Inverse( yCubic, y, 0, 1 );
2328  }
2329 
2330 #if defined(PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER) && PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER >= 2
2331  app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type end_InverseYOfBezierSegment_time = app_traits::context_type::current_time();
2332  m_time_spent_in_InverseYOfBezierSegment += end_InverseYOfBezierSegment_time - start_InverseYOfBezierSegment_time;
2333  ++m_numTimesInverseYOfBezierSegmentWasCalled;
2334 #endif
2335 }
2336 
2337 template<typename app_traits>
2338 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::SplitOffLowTSideOfBezierSegmentAtTPinningCentralYValue( BezierSegment<point_type>& seg, BezierSegment<point_type>& lowSeg, real_type t, real_type y )
2339 {
2340  real_type t1 = 1 - t;
2341 
2342  lowSeg.controlPoint[0] = seg.controlPoint[0];
2343 
2344  get_x(lowSeg.controlPoint[1]) = get_x(seg.controlPoint[0]) * t1 + get_x(seg.controlPoint[1]) * t;
2345  get_y(lowSeg.controlPoint[1]) = get_y(seg.controlPoint[0]) * t1 + get_y(seg.controlPoint[1]) * t;
2346 
2347  // using seg.controlPoint[0] as temporary variable here
2348  get_x(seg.controlPoint[0]) = get_x(seg.controlPoint[1]) * t1 + get_x(seg.controlPoint[2]) * t;
2349  get_y(seg.controlPoint[0]) = get_y(seg.controlPoint[1]) * t1 + get_y(seg.controlPoint[2]) * t;
2350 
2351  get_x(seg.controlPoint[2]) = get_x(seg.controlPoint[2]) * t1 + get_x(seg.controlPoint[3]) * t;
2352  get_y(seg.controlPoint[2]) = get_y(seg.controlPoint[2]) * t1 + get_y(seg.controlPoint[3]) * t;
2353 
2354  get_x(seg.controlPoint[1]) = get_x(seg.controlPoint[0]) * t1 + get_x(seg.controlPoint[2]) * t;
2355  get_y(seg.controlPoint[1]) = get_y(seg.controlPoint[0]) * t1 + get_y(seg.controlPoint[2]) * t;
2356 
2357  get_x(lowSeg.controlPoint[2]) = get_x(lowSeg.controlPoint[1]) * t1 + get_x(seg.controlPoint[0]) * t;
2358  get_y(lowSeg.controlPoint[2]) = get_y(lowSeg.controlPoint[1]) * t1 + get_y(seg.controlPoint[0]) * t;
2359 
2360  // seg.controlPoint[0] gets set to the correct value here, along with lowSeg.controlPoint[3]
2361  get_x(lowSeg.controlPoint[3]) = get_x(seg.controlPoint[0]) = get_x(lowSeg.controlPoint[2]) * t1 + get_x(seg.controlPoint[1]) * t;
2362  // pin y value, and assert that it would have been close to the value at which we are pinning it.
2363  //get_y(lowSeg.controlPoint[3]) = get_y(seg.controlPoint[0]) = get_y(lowSeg.controlPoint[2]) * t1 + get_y(seg.controlPoint[1]) * t;
2364  get_y(lowSeg.controlPoint[3]) = get_y(seg.controlPoint[0]) = y;
2365  #ifdef TETRAPHILIA_SUPPORT_REDUCER_PRECISION_ASSERT
2366  real_type computedY = get_y(lowSeg.controlPoint[2]) * t1 + get_y(seg.controlPoint[1]) * t;
2367  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( AbsVal( computedY - y ) <= 0.01 );
2368  #endif
2369 }
2370 
2371 template<typename app_traits>
2372 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::IntersectLineSegmentsWhichAreClosedAtTopAndOpenAtBottom( const IntervalBezierSegment<real_type>& bez0,
2373  const IntervalBezierSegment<real_type>& bez1,
2374  IntersectionParameters<real_type>* intersectionParams,
2375  int& numIntersections )
2376 {
2377  // intersection between lines must exist in band
2378  real_type array[6];
2379  real_type& deltaX0 = array[0];
2380  real_type& deltaY0 = array[1];
2381  real_type& deltaX1 = array[2];
2382  real_type& deltaY1 = array[3];
2383  real_type& deltaTopX = array[4];
2384  real_type& deltaTopY = array[5];
2385 
2386  deltaX0 = bez0.xbot - bez0.xtop;
2387  deltaY0 = bez0.ybot - bez0.ytop;
2388  deltaX1 = bez1.xbot - bez1.xtop;
2389  deltaY1 = bez1.ybot - bez1.ytop;
2390  deltaTopX = bez0.xtop - bez1.xtop;
2391  deltaTopY = bez0.ytop - bez1.ytop;
2392 
2393  real_type largestAbs = MaxAbsVal(array, 6);
2394 
2395  ScaleArrayUpOrDownToAvoidMulOverflowOrUnderflow(&array[0], 6, largestAbs);
2396 
2397  real_type denom = deltaX0 * deltaY1 - deltaX1 * deltaY0;
2398  real_type num0 = deltaTopY * deltaX1 - deltaTopX * deltaY1;
2399  real_type num1 = deltaTopY * deltaX0 - deltaTopX * deltaY0;
2400  if (denom == 0)
2401  return; // parallel or identical lines
2402 
2403  bool edge0SwitchingFromRightToLeft = (denom < 0); // set this before potentially modifying denom
2404 
2405  if (denom < 0) {
2406  denom = -denom;
2407  num0 = -num0;
2408  num1 = -num1;
2409  }
2410 
2411  if ( num0 < 0 || num1 < 0 || num0 >= denom || num1 >= denom )
2412  return; // intersection of lines does not occur between the specified finite segments
2413 
2414  // Have seen cases where t's should be computed to be 0 and 1 but end up as 0 and 0.99999999 due to rounding issues in FPU.
2415  //if ( (num0 == 0 && bez0.ytop == bez1.ybot && bez0.xtop == bez1.xbot) ||
2416  // (num1 == 0 && bez0.ybot == bez1.ytop && bez0.xbot == bez1.xtop) )
2417  // return;
2418 
2419  // FOUND NEW INTERSECTION!
2420 
2421  // Mathematically, a line and a bezier can intersect at most 3 times, and 2 beziers can intersect at most 9 times.
2422  // Moreover, we strongly suspect (but have not proven) that x&y MONOTONE bezier segements can intersect at most 5 times.
2423  // However due to precision limitations, 2 edges which are very very close together can report MANY MANY intersections
2424  // (we've seen cases of 20 reported intersections between 2 edges in a scanline, and one could probably manufacture worse cases).
2425  // Thus, our strategy is to report at most 5 intersections. If parity dictates it, we will later on remove the final intersection to have just 4 intersections.
2426  // This allows us to use a fixed-size buffer for the intersection data and not worry about overflow.
2427  if ( numIntersections == 5 )
2428  return; // we refuse to store more than 5 intersections for a pair of edges in a scanline.
2429 
2430  IntersectionParameters<real_type>& params = intersectionParams[numIntersections++];
2431  params.edge0SwitchingFromRightToLeft = edge0SwitchingFromRightToLeft;
2432 
2433  real_type t0 = num0 / denom;
2434  real_type t1 = num1 / denom;
2435  tetraphilia_assert( t0 >= 0 && t0 <= 1 );
2436  tetraphilia_assert( t1 >= 0 && t1 <= 1 );
2437  tetraphilia_assert( t0 < 1 || t1 < 1 );
2438 
2439  // We choose the y value from the segment with the smallest delta-t, otherwise we choose the max y value since we're asserting that they should have crossed by this value.
2440  // It is possible that the y value is not even in the other segment's y-range due to numerical precision limits here.
2441  real_type y0 = bez0.ytop + (bez0.ybot - bez0.ytop) * t0;
2442  real_type y1 = bez1.ytop + (bez1.ybot - bez1.ytop) * t1;
2443  real_type deltaDeltaT = (bez0.tbot - bez0.ttop) - (bez1.tbot - bez1.ttop);
2444  params.y = (deltaDeltaT < 0) ? y0 :
2445  ((deltaDeltaT > 0) ? y1 : t4::max<real_type>( y0, y1 ));
2446  // MAY NOT EVER USE t[0] or t[1] values?? TODO: bkaskel
2447  params.t[0] = bez0.ttop + (bez0.tbot - bez0.ttop) * t0;
2448  params.t[1] = bez1.ttop + (bez1.tbot - bez1.ttop) * t1;
2449  params.x = bez0.xtop + (bez0.xbot - bez0.xtop) * t0; // bez0.xtop * (1-t0) + bez0.xbot * t0;
2450  if (bez1.xtop <= bez1.xbot) {
2451  if (params.x < bez1.xtop) {
2452  params.x = bez1.xtop;
2453  }
2454  else if (params.x > bez1.xbot) {
2455  params.x = bez1.xbot;
2456  }
2457  }
2458  else {
2459  if (params.x > bez1.xtop) {
2460  params.x = bez1.xtop;
2461  }
2462  else if (params.x < bez1.xbot) {
2463  params.x = bez1.xbot;
2464  }
2465  }
2466  tetraphilia_assert( 0 <= bez0.ttop && bez0.ttop <= bez0.tbot && bez0.tbot <= 1 );
2467  tetraphilia_assert( 0 <= bez1.ttop && bez1.ttop <= bez1.tbot && bez1.tbot <= 1 );
2468  tetraphilia_assert( bez0.ttop <= params.t[0] && params.t[0] <= bez0.tbot );
2469  tetraphilia_assert( bez1.ttop <= params.t[1] && params.t[1] <= bez1.tbot );
2470 // tetraphilia_assert( bez0.ytop <= params.y && params.y <= bez0.ybot ); // May not be true if we chose y1
2471 // tetraphilia_assert( bez1.ytop <= params.y && params.y <= bez1.ybot ); // May not be true if we chose y0
2472  tetraphilia_assert( (bez0.xtop < bez0.xbot && bez0.xtop <= params.x && params.x <= bez0.xbot) ||
2473  (bez0.xtop > bez0.xbot && bez0.xtop >= params.x && params.x >= bez0.xbot) ||
2474  (bez0.xtop == bez0.xbot && bez0.xtop == params.x && params.x == bez0.xbot) );
2475 }
2476 
2477 // Int_Sub implementation whereby we don't pass bezier segments here and instead evaluate midpoints by subsituting t into original power-polynomials using Horner's rule
2478 template<typename app_traits>
2479 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::recursiveIntervalBezierSubdivision( int remainingDepth0, int remainingDepth1,
2480  const IntervalBezierSegment<real_type>& bez0, const IntervalBezierSegment<real_type>& bez1,
2481  const IntersectionData<real_type>& id, IntersectionParameters<real_type>* params, int& numIntersections )
2482 {
2483  // check y values to see if bboxes do not intersect
2484  // (curves are assumed to be monotonic with increasing y however we cannot
2485  // rule out the possibility that one or both curves has multiple points at
2486  // the same y value due to numeric precision limitations)
2487  if ( bez0.ybot < bez1.ytop || bez1.ybot < bez0.ytop )
2488  return;
2489 
2490  // check x values to see if bboxes do not intersect (curves are assumed to be monotonic so only need to consider endpoints)
2491  real_type xmin = bez0.xtop;
2492  real_type xmax = bez0.xbot;
2493  if ( xmax < xmin )
2494  boost::swap( xmin, xmax );
2495  real_type x1top = bez1.xtop;
2496  real_type x1bot = bez1.xbot;
2497  if ( xmax < x1top && xmax < x1bot )
2498  return;
2499  if ( xmin > x1top && xmin > x1bot )
2500  return;
2501 
2502  if ( remainingDepth0 ) {
2503  --remainingDepth0;
2504  real_type tmid0 = Average(bez0.ttop, bez0.tbot);
2505  real_type xmid0 = (((id.x0PowerSeriesCoefficient[0] * tmid0 + id.x0PowerSeriesCoefficient[1]) * tmid0 + id.x0PowerSeriesCoefficient[2]) * tmid0 + id.x0PowerSeriesCoefficient[3]);
2506  real_type ymid0 = (((id.y0PowerSeriesCoefficient[0] * tmid0 + id.y0PowerSeriesCoefficient[1]) * tmid0 + id.y0PowerSeriesCoefficient[2]) * tmid0 + id.y0PowerSeriesCoefficient[3]);
2507  tetraphilia_assert( bez0.ttop <= tmid0 && tmid0 <= bez0.tbot );
2508  if ( bez0.xtop <= bez0.xbot ) {
2509  if ( xmid0 < bez0.xtop )
2510  xmid0 = bez0.xtop;
2511  else if ( xmid0 > bez0.xbot )
2512  xmid0 = bez0.xbot;
2513  } else {
2514  if ( xmid0 > bez0.xtop )
2515  xmid0 = bez0.xtop;
2516  else if ( xmid0 < bez0.xbot )
2517  xmid0 = bez0.xbot;
2518  }
2519  if ( ymid0 < bez0.ytop )
2520  ymid0 = bez0.ytop;
2521  else if ( ymid0 > bez0.ybot )
2522  ymid0 = bez0.ybot;
2523  tetraphilia_assert( (bez0.xtop <= xmid0 && xmid0 <= bez0.xbot) || (bez0.xtop >= xmid0 && xmid0 >= bez0.xbot) );
2524  if ( (bez0.ytop < ymid0 && ymid0 < bez0.ybot) || (bez0.xtop != xmid0 && xmid0 != bez0.xbot) ) {
2525 
2526  IntervalBezierSegment<real_type> b00( bez0.xtop, bez0.ytop, bez0.ttop, xmid0, ymid0, tmid0 );
2527  IntervalBezierSegment<real_type> b01( xmid0, ymid0, tmid0, bez0.xbot, bez0.ybot, bez0.tbot );
2528 
2529  if ( remainingDepth1 ) {
2530  --remainingDepth1;
2531  real_type tmid1 = Average(bez1.ttop, bez1.tbot);
2532  real_type xmid1 = (((id.x1PowerSeriesCoefficient[0] * tmid1 + id.x1PowerSeriesCoefficient[1]) * tmid1 + id.x1PowerSeriesCoefficient[2]) * tmid1 + id.x1PowerSeriesCoefficient[3]);
2533  real_type ymid1 = (((id.y1PowerSeriesCoefficient[0] * tmid1 + id.y1PowerSeriesCoefficient[1]) * tmid1 + id.y1PowerSeriesCoefficient[2]) * tmid1 + id.y1PowerSeriesCoefficient[3]);
2534  tetraphilia_assert( bez1.ttop <= tmid1 && tmid1 <= bez1.tbot );
2535  if ( bez1.xtop <= bez1.xbot ) {
2536  if ( xmid1 < bez1.xtop )
2537  xmid1 = bez1.xtop;
2538  else if ( xmid1 > bez1.xbot )
2539  xmid1 = bez1.xbot;
2540  } else {
2541  if ( xmid1 > bez1.xtop )
2542  xmid1 = bez1.xtop;
2543  else if ( xmid1 < bez1.xbot )
2544  xmid1 = bez1.xbot;
2545  }
2546  if ( ymid1 < bez1.ytop )
2547  ymid1 = bez1.ytop;
2548  else if ( ymid1 > bez1.ybot )
2549  ymid1 = bez1.ybot;
2550  tetraphilia_assert( (bez1.xtop <= xmid1 && xmid1 <= bez1.xbot) || (bez1.xtop >= xmid1 && xmid1 >= bez1.xbot) );
2551 
2552  if ( (bez1.ytop < ymid1 && ymid1 < bez1.ybot) || (bez1.xtop != xmid1 && xmid1 != bez1.xbot) ) {
2553  IntervalBezierSegment<real_type> b10( bez1.xtop, bez1.ytop, bez1.ttop, xmid1, ymid1, tmid1 );
2554  IntervalBezierSegment<real_type> b11( xmid1, ymid1, tmid1, bez1.xbot, bez1.ybot, bez1.tbot );
2555  recursiveIntervalBezierSubdivision( remainingDepth0, remainingDepth1, b00, b10, id, params, numIntersections );
2556  recursiveIntervalBezierSubdivision( remainingDepth0, remainingDepth1, b00, b11, id, params, numIntersections );
2557  recursiveIntervalBezierSubdivision( remainingDepth0, remainingDepth1, b01, b10, id, params, numIntersections );
2558  recursiveIntervalBezierSubdivision( remainingDepth0, remainingDepth1, b01, b11, id, params, numIntersections );
2559  } else {
2560  // no point spliting bez1 any further
2561  recursiveIntervalBezierSubdivision( remainingDepth0, 0, b00, bez1, id, params, numIntersections );
2562  recursiveIntervalBezierSubdivision( remainingDepth0, 0, b01, bez1, id, params, numIntersections );
2563  }
2564  } else {
2565  recursiveIntervalBezierSubdivision( remainingDepth0, 0, b00, bez1, id, params, numIntersections );
2566  recursiveIntervalBezierSubdivision( remainingDepth0, 0, b01, bez1, id, params, numIntersections );
2567  }
2568  } else {
2569  // no point spliting bez0 any further
2570  recursiveIntervalBezierSubdivision( 0, remainingDepth1, bez0, bez1, id, params, numIntersections );
2571  }
2572  } else if ( remainingDepth1 ) {
2573  --remainingDepth1;
2574  real_type tmid1 = Average(bez1.ttop, bez1.tbot);
2575  real_type xmid1 = (((id.x1PowerSeriesCoefficient[0] * tmid1 + id.x1PowerSeriesCoefficient[1]) * tmid1 + id.x1PowerSeriesCoefficient[2]) * tmid1 + id.x1PowerSeriesCoefficient[3]);
2576  real_type ymid1 = (((id.y1PowerSeriesCoefficient[0] * tmid1 + id.y1PowerSeriesCoefficient[1]) * tmid1 + id.y1PowerSeriesCoefficient[2]) * tmid1 + id.y1PowerSeriesCoefficient[3]);
2577  tetraphilia_assert( bez1.ttop <= tmid1 && tmid1 <= bez1.tbot );
2578  if ( bez1.xtop <= bez1.xbot ) {
2579  if ( xmid1 < bez1.xtop )
2580  xmid1 = bez1.xtop;
2581  else if ( xmid1 > bez1.xbot )
2582  xmid1 = bez1.xbot;
2583  } else {
2584  if ( xmid1 > bez1.xtop )
2585  xmid1 = bez1.xtop;
2586  else if ( xmid1 < bez1.xbot )
2587  xmid1 = bez1.xbot;
2588  }
2589  if ( ymid1 < bez1.ytop )
2590  ymid1 = bez1.ytop;
2591  else if ( ymid1 > bez1.ybot )
2592  ymid1 = bez1.ybot;
2593  tetraphilia_assert( (bez1.xtop <= xmid1 && xmid1 <= bez1.xbot) || (bez1.xtop >= xmid1 && xmid1 >= bez1.xbot) );
2594 
2595  if ( (bez1.ytop < ymid1 && ymid1 < bez1.ybot) || (bez1.xtop != xmid1 && xmid1 != bez1.xbot) ) {
2596  IntervalBezierSegment<real_type> b10( bez1.xtop, bez1.ytop, bez1.ttop, xmid1, ymid1, tmid1 );
2597  IntervalBezierSegment<real_type> b11( xmid1, ymid1, tmid1, bez1.xbot, bez1.ybot, bez1.tbot );
2598 
2599  recursiveIntervalBezierSubdivision( 0, remainingDepth1, bez0, b10, id, params, numIntersections );
2600  recursiveIntervalBezierSubdivision( 0, remainingDepth1, bez0, b11, id, params, numIntersections );
2601  } else {
2602  // no point spliting bez1 any further
2603  recursiveIntervalBezierSubdivision( 0, 0, bez0, bez1, id, params, numIntersections );
2604  }
2605 
2606  } else {
2607  // find intersection of lines between endpoints of bez0 and bez1
2608  IntersectLineSegmentsWhichAreClosedAtTopAndOpenAtBottom( bez0, bez1, params, numIntersections );
2609  }
2610 }
2611 
2612 template<typename app_traits>
2613 int bezier_sampler<app_traits>::ComputeRequiredDepthForSegment( const BezierSegment<point_type>& seg )
2614 {
2615  using namespace t4::literals;
2616 
2617  #define INV_EPS_FOR_REQUIRED_DEPTH 3000
2618  real_type absCurvatureTop_x = AbsVal(get_x(seg.controlPoint[2]) - 2 * get_x(seg.controlPoint[1]) + get_x(seg.controlPoint[0]));
2619  real_type absCurvatureTop_y = AbsVal(get_y(seg.controlPoint[2]) - 2 * get_y(seg.controlPoint[1]) + get_y(seg.controlPoint[0]));
2620  real_type absCurvatureBot_x = AbsVal(get_x(seg.controlPoint[3]) - 2 * get_x(seg.controlPoint[2]) + get_x(seg.controlPoint[1]));
2621  real_type absCurvatureBot_y = AbsVal(get_y(seg.controlPoint[3]) - 2 * get_y(seg.controlPoint[2]) + get_y(seg.controlPoint[1]));
2622  real_type maxCurvature_x = t4::max<real_type>( absCurvatureTop_x, absCurvatureBot_x );
2623  real_type maxCurvature_y = t4::max<real_type>( absCurvatureTop_y, absCurvatureBot_y );
2624  real_type l0 = t4::max<real_type>( maxCurvature_x, maxCurvature_y );
2625  real_type z = 1.4142135623730950488016887242097_r * 0.75_r * INV_EPS_FOR_REQUIRED_DEPTH);
2626  int e;
2627  if ( l0 <= 1 ) {
2628  z = z * l0;
2629  if ( z <= 1 )
2630  return 0;
2631  e = Exponent(z);
2632  } else {
2633  // if l0 > 1 we need to be more robust to prevent potential fixed-point overflow
2634  e = Exponent( z ) + Exponent( l0 );
2635  if ( e <= 0 )
2636  return 0;
2637  }
2638 
2639  return e / 2 + 1; // in place of (int)ceil(log4(z));
2640 }
2641 
2642 // Keep this around, and perform timing analysis against the subdivision method.
2643 // It might make sense to use this method unless the resulting cubic has a very small norm (all coefficients are small).
2644 template<typename app_traits>
2645 int bezier_sampler<app_traits>::ComputeIntersectionInvolvingAtLeastOneCurve( edge_type* leftEdge, edge_type* rightEdge, real_type yBandMin, real_type yBandMax )
2646 {
2647 #if defined(PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER) && PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER >= 2
2648  app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type start_curve_intersection_time = app_traits::context_type::current_time();
2649 #endif
2650 
2651  tetraphilia_assert( !leftEdge->isLine || !rightEdge->isLine );
2652  tetraphilia_assert( !leftEdge->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine || !rightEdge->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine );
2653 
2654  IntersectionData<real_type> id;
2655  IntersectionParameters<real_type> param[6]; // algorithm below has been limited to report no more than 5 intersections! Then we might add another to get the parity right.
2656  int numIntersections = 0;
2657  bool skipSubdivision = false;
2658 
2659  // short-circuit for edges with bottom or top coinciding and which have oppositely oriented slopes.
2660  if ( leftEdge->deltaXSign != rightEdge->deltaXSign )
2661  {
2662  tetraphilia_assert( leftEdge->top() != rightEdge->top() || leftEdge->bot() != rightEdge->bot() ); // can't be equal at top and bottom, but could be equal at one of them
2663 
2664  if ( leftActive->curXBandTop == rightActive->curXBandTop ) {
2665  skipSubdivision = true;
2666  if ( leftEdge->deltaXSign > rightEdge->deltaXSign ) {
2667  param[0].x = leftActive->curXBandTop;
2668  param[0].y = yBandMin;
2669  param[0].t[0] = param[0].t[1] = 0;
2670  param[0].edge0SwitchingFromRightToLeft = false;
2671  numIntersections = 1;
2672  }
2673  }
2674  else if ( leftActive->curXBandBot == rightActive->curXBandBot ) {
2675  skipSubdivision = true;
2676  }
2677  }
2678 
2679  if ( !skipSubdivision ) {
2680  IntervalBezierSegment<real_type> leftIntSegment( leftActive->curXBandTop, yBandMin, 0, leftActive->curXBandBot, yBandMax, real_type(1));
2681  IntervalBezierSegment<real_type> rightIntSegment( rightActive->curXBandTop, yBandMin, 0, rightActive->curXBandBot, yBandMax, real_type(1));
2682 
2683  int rightNumSubdivisionLevels;
2684  int leftNumSubdivisionLevels;
2685 
2686  if ( !leftEdge->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine ) {
2687  BezierSegment<point_type> leftSegment;
2688  InitLocalBezierObject( leftEdge, leftSegment, yBandMin, yBandMax );
2689  leftNumSubdivisionLevels = ComputeRequiredDepthForSegment( leftSegment );
2690  if ( leftNumSubdivisionLevels ) {
2691  // precompute parametrization power series values for segment
2692  GetPowerSeriesCoefficientsFromBernsteinCoefficients( get_x(leftSegment.controlPoint[0]), get_x(leftSegment.controlPoint[1]), get_x(leftSegment.controlPoint[2]), get_x(leftSegment.controlPoint[3]), &id.x0PowerSeriesCoefficient[0] );
2693  GetPowerSeriesCoefficientsFromBernsteinCoefficients( get_y(leftSegment.controlPoint[0]), get_y(leftSegment.controlPoint[1]), get_y(leftSegment.controlPoint[2]), get_y(leftSegment.controlPoint[3]), &id.y0PowerSeriesCoefficient[0] );
2694  }
2695  } else
2696  leftNumSubdivisionLevels = 0;
2697 
2698 
2699  if ( !rightEdge->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine ) {
2700  BezierSegment<point_type> rightSegment;
2701  InitLocalBezierObject( rightEdge, rightSegment, yBandMin, yBandMax );
2702  rightNumSubdivisionLevels = ComputeRequiredDepthForSegment( rightSegment );
2703  if ( rightNumSubdivisionLevels ) {
2704  // precompute parametrization power series values for segment
2705  GetPowerSeriesCoefficientsFromBernsteinCoefficients( get_x(rightSegment.controlPoint[0]), get_x(rightSegment.controlPoint[1]), get_x(rightSegment.controlPoint[2]), get_x(rightSegment.controlPoint[3]), &id.x1PowerSeriesCoefficient[0] );
2706  GetPowerSeriesCoefficientsFromBernsteinCoefficients( get_y(rightSegment.controlPoint[0]), get_y(rightSegment.controlPoint[1]), get_y(rightSegment.controlPoint[2]), get_y(rightSegment.controlPoint[3]), &id.y1PowerSeriesCoefficient[0] );
2707  }
2708  } else
2709  rightNumSubdivisionLevels = 0;
2710 
2711  // Find intersections between the two edges in the current scanline.
2712  // Mathematically we don't believe there can be more than 5 intersections between 2 monotone
2713  // bezier curve segments, however in Fixed point builds we have seen cases where 20+ intersection are found due to precision limitations.
2714  recursiveIntervalBezierSubdivision( leftNumSubdivisionLevels, rightNumSubdivisionLevels,
2715  leftIntSegment, rightIntSegment,
2716  id, &param[0], numIntersections );
2717 
2718  tetraphilia_assert( numIntersections >= 0 && numIntersections <= 5 ); // algorithm currently LIMITS the number of reported intersections to FIVE!!
2719 
2720  #ifndef NDEBUG
2721  {
2722  // Assert any returned intersections have values in order of y-values and that there are no duplicate points
2723  for ( int i = 1; i < numIntersections; ++i ) {
2724  tetraphilia_assert( param[i].y >= param[i-1].y );
2725  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( param[i].x != param[i-1].x || param[i].y != param[i-1].y ); // must expect this can happen (have seen it happen) -- it will be very hard to bullet proof the intersection code to prevent this in all cases
2726  }
2727  }
2728  #endif
2729 
2730  // CAN HAVE BOTTOM POINTS! If intersection is slightly above bottom but very close to bottom point. This shows up especially in fixed point builds.
2732  //tetraphilia_assert( numIntersections == 0 || param[numIntersections-1].x != leftIntSegment.xbot || param[numIntersections-1].y != leftIntSegment.ybot );
2733  //tetraphilia_assert( numIntersections == 0 || param[numIntersections-1].x != rightIntSegment.xbot || param[numIntersections-1].y != rightIntSegment.ybot );
2734 
2735  // post-process intersections
2736 
2737  // if tops points match and bottoms points do not match then there must be at least one intersection point found
2738  tetraphilia_assert( leftActive->curXBandTop != rightActive->curXBandTop || leftActive->curXBandBot == rightActive->curXBandBot || numIntersections > 0 );
2739 
2740  // make sure list is consistent. Inconsistencies should only arise from cases where a vertex of a flattened segment was an intersection point and led to a tangency,
2741  // though possibly also from extremely pathological cases where precision breaks down in our real-valued datatype.
2742  bool curve0IsOnLeft = true; // curve0 starts as the left-hand curve by definition
2743  for ( int i = 0; i < numIntersections; ) {
2744  if ( param[i].edge0SwitchingFromRightToLeft == curve0IsOnLeft ) {
2745  // overwrite param[i]
2746  for ( int j = i + 1; j < numIntersections; ++j )
2747  param[j-1] = param[j];
2748  --numIntersections;
2749  }
2750  else {
2751  curve0IsOnLeft = !curve0IsOnLeft;
2752  ++i;
2753  }
2754  }
2755 
2756  // Correct parity if necessary.
2757  if ( leftActive->curXBandBot != rightActive->curXBandBot ) {
2758  bool parityMustBeEven = (leftActive->curXBandBot < rightActive->curXBandBot);
2759  if ( parityMustBeEven != ((numIntersections&1)==0) ) {
2760  // This case is fallback for when the parity is wrong.
2761  tetraphilia_assert( numIntersections == 0 || param[numIntersections - 1].edge0SwitchingFromRightToLeft != parityMustBeEven );
2762  real_type x;
2763  if ( leftEdge->deltaX == 0 )
2764  x = leftActive->curXBandBot;
2765  else if ( rightEdge->deltaX == 0 )
2766  x = rightActive->curXBandBot;
2767  else {
2768  if ( numIntersections ) {
2769  real_type intersectionX = param[numIntersections - 1].x;
2770  if ( AbsVal( leftActive->curXBandBot - intersectionX ) < AbsVal( rightActive->curXBandBot - intersectionX ) )
2771  x = leftActive->curXBandBot;
2772  else
2773  x = rightActive->curXBandBot;
2774  }
2775  else {
2776  real_type leftMin = t4::min<real_type>( leftActive->curXBandTop, leftActive->curXBandBot );
2777  real_type leftMax = t4::max<real_type>( leftActive->curXBandTop, leftActive->curXBandBot );
2778  real_type rightMin = t4::min<real_type>( rightActive->curXBandTop, rightActive->curXBandBot );
2779  real_type rightMax = t4::max<real_type>( rightActive->curXBandTop, rightActive->curXBandBot );
2780  x = Average(t4::max<real_type>(leftMin, rightMin), t4::min<real_type>(leftMax, rightMax));
2781  }
2782  }
2783  IntersectionParameters<real_type>& p = param[numIntersections++];
2784  p.edge0SwitchingFromRightToLeft = parityMustBeEven;
2785  p.x = x;
2786  p.y = yBandMax;
2787  p.t[0] = p.t[1] = 1;
2788  }
2789  }
2790 
2791  // finally, remove any consecutive intersection which have the same y-value.
2792  // The internal if-block here should be hit VERY RARELY.
2793  // ?? Possibly gets hit often for stroke joins?
2794  for ( int k = 1; k < numIntersections; ) {
2795  if ( param[k].y == param[k-1].y ) {
2796  // remove param[k] and param[k-1]
2797  for ( int j = k + 1; j < numIntersections; ++j )
2798  param[j-2] = param[j];
2799  numIntersections -= 2;
2800  }
2801  else
2802  ++k;
2803  }
2804 
2805  // since we've already ruled out the tops and bottoms coinciding if the deltaValSigns are opposite, this should hold
2806  tetraphilia_assert( leftEdge->deltaXSign == rightEdge->deltaXSign || numIntersections >= 1 ); // if slopes are opposite then must be exactly 1 though it could conceivably have been counted more than once at this point
2807 
2808  // parity check when bottoms do not coincide
2809  tetraphilia_assert( leftActive->curXBandBot == rightActive->curXBandBot ||
2810  ((leftActive->curXBandBot < rightActive->curXBandBot) == ((numIntersections&1)==0)) );
2811 
2812  // if edges are not sloped the same direction, they must intersect exactly once
2813  tetraphilia_assert( leftEdge->deltaXSign == rightEdge->deltaXSign || numIntersections == 1 );
2814  }
2815 
2816  // adjust t values from scanline-based values to be those for the edges global control points and record intersections
2817  for (int i = 0; i < numIntersections; ++i) {
2818 
2819  tetraphilia_assert( param[i].y >= yBandMin && param[i].y <= yBandMax );
2820  tetraphilia_assert( (leftEdge->deltaXSign == 1 && param[i].x >= leftActive->curXBandTop && param[i].x <= leftActive->curXBandBot) ||
2821  (leftEdge->deltaXSign == -1 && param[i].x <= leftActive->curXBandTop && param[i].x >= leftActive->curXBandBot) ||
2822  (leftEdge->deltaXSign == 0 && param[i].x == leftActive->curXBandTop && param[i].x == leftActive->curXBandBot) );
2823  tetraphilia_assert( (rightEdge->deltaXSign == 1 && param[i].x >= rightActive->curXBandTop && param[i].x <= rightActive->curXBandBot) ||
2824  (rightEdge->deltaXSign == -1 && param[i].x <= rightActive->curXBandTop && param[i].x >= rightActive->curXBandBot) ||
2825  (rightEdge->deltaXSign == 0 && param[i].x == rightActive->curXBandTop && param[i].x == rightActive->curXBandBot) );
2826 
2827  // t1 and t2 in params are currently relative to the local segment, here we make them global to the edge control points
2828  if ( !leftEdge->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine ) {
2829  tetraphilia_assert( 0 <= leftEdge->curTBandTop && leftEdge->curTBandTop <= leftEdge->curTBandBot && leftEdge->curTBandBot <= 1 );
2830  param[i].t[0] = leftEdge->curTBandTop * (1 - param[i].t[0]) + leftEdge->curTBandBot * param[i].t[0];
2831  }
2832 
2833  if ( !rightEdge->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine ) {
2834  tetraphilia_assert( 0 <= rightEdge->curTBandTop && rightEdge->curTBandTop <= rightEdge->curTBandBot && rightEdge->curTBandBot <= 1 );
2835  param[i].t[1] = rightEdge->curTBandTop * (1 - param[i].t[1]) + rightEdge->curTBandBot * param[i].t[1];
2836  }
2837 
2838  AddIntersection(
2839 #ifdef RECORD_INTERSECTION_X_VALUES
2840  param[i].x,
2841 #endif
2842  param[i].y, leftEdge, param[i].t[0], rightEdge, param[i].t[1], yBandMin
2843  );
2844  }
2845 
2846 #if defined(PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER) && PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER >= 2
2847  app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type end_curve_intersection_time = app_traits::context_type::current_time();
2848  m_time_spent_in_intersection_checks += end_curve_intersection_time - start_curve_intersection_time;
2849  ++m_numCurveIntersectionChecks;
2850 #endif
2851 
2852  return numIntersections;
2853 }
2854 #endif // COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
2855 
2856 #ifndef NDEBUG
2857 template<typename app_traits>
2858 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::assertWindingNumbersAreCorrect()
2859 {
2860  tetraphilia_assert( m_highestActiveEdgeIndex < 0 || m_edgeSorts[m_highestActiveEdgeIndex] != nullptr );
2861  int w = 0;
2862  for (int i = 0; i <= m_highestActiveEdgeIndex; ++i) {
2863  edge_type* e = m_edgeSorts[i];
2864  if (e) {
2865  active_edge_type *active = e->activeData;
2866  tetraphilia_assert( w + e->windingNum == active->curWindingToRightOfEdge );
2867  w = active->curWindingToRightOfEdge;
2868  }
2869  }
2870  tetraphilia_assert( w == 0 );
2871 }
2872 #endif // NDEBUG
2873 
2874 template<typename app_traits>
2875 void bezier_sampler<app_traits>::NextScanLine( int_type y )
2876 {
2877  if (m_constraintsEmpty)
2878  return;
2879 
2880  tetraphilia_assert( y >= m_curScanLine );
2881 
2882 #ifdef PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER
2883  app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type start_nextscanline_time = app_traits::context_type::current_time();
2884 #endif
2885 
2886  bool recomputeEdgeTopData = ( y > m_curScanLine + 1 );
2887 
2888  // In expected use, we won't use this block since we expect scanlines to be requested in order without skipping any scanlines
2889  // so we need not recompute the Top values for each edge in the expected case since they should already be in the Bot values from the previous scanline.
2890  while ( m_curScanLine < y ) {
2891  int_type nextY = m_curScanLine + 1;
2892  while ( m_curEdgeInsertionDeletion->m_yVal < nextY )
2893  ProcessNextEdgeInsertionDeletionChange( m_curScanLine );
2894  m_curScanLine = nextY;
2895  }
2896 
2897  // In most cases we expect recomputeEdgeTopData to be false.
2898  if ( recomputeEdgeTopData )
2899  {
2900  SetEdgeTopDataForTopOfCurrentScanLine(m_curScanLine); // TODO: bkaskel: make sure this also sets the Bot data since below we will copy the bot data to the Top data.
2901 
2902  // resort edges
2903  edge_type** dst = nullptr;
2904  bool moveData = false;
2905  for ( int edgeCount = 0; edgeCount <= m_highestActiveEdgeIndex; edgeCount++ ) {
2906  if ( m_edgeSorts[edgeCount] == nullptr ) {
2907  if ( !moveData ) {
2908  moveData = true;
2909  dst = &m_edgeSorts[edgeCount];
2910  }
2911  }
2912  else if ( moveData ) {
2913  *dst++ = m_edgeSorts[edgeCount];
2914  }
2915  }
2916  tetraphilia_assert( !moveData || dst == &m_edgeSorts[m_numActiveEdges] ); // asserts we ended up where we expected, filling up m_edgeSorts with m_numActiveEdges edges
2917  if ( moveData ) {
2918  edge_type** end = &m_edgeSorts[m_highestActiveEdgeIndex];
2919  while ( dst <= end )
2920  *dst++ = nullptr; // NULL out remaining slots
2921  }
2922  m_highestActiveEdgeIndex = m_numActiveEdges - 1;
2923  SortActiveEdges();
2924  }
2925 
2926  tetraphilia_assert( y == m_curScanLine );
2927 
2928  // declare/initialize some real-valued y-vals
2929  const real_type yScanLineStart = real_type(y);
2930  const real_type yScanLineEnd = yScanLineStart + 1;
2931  real_type yBandMin;
2932  real_type yBandMax;
2933 
2934  // make sure we have computed curXCross for the top and bottom of the current scanline
2935  {
2936  for ( int edgeCount = 0; edgeCount <= m_highestActiveEdgeIndex; edgeCount++ ) {
2937  edge_type* edge = m_edgeSorts[edgeCount];
2938  if ( edge && !edge->isLine ) { // for all curves here, even if the curve will be considered to be a line inside this scanline
2939  active_edge_type *active = edge->activeData;
2940  tetraphilia_assert(active);
2941  while ( active->crossingBuffBotY <= yScanLineStart )
2942  ComputeCrossingTable( edge );
2943  tetraphilia_assert( y - active->crossingBuffTopY >= 0 && y < active->crossingBuffBotY );
2944  active->curXCross = &(*active->crossingXBufferPtr)[ static_cast<size_t>( y - active->crossingBuffTopY ) ];
2945  #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
2946  active->curTCross = &active->crossingTBufferPtr[y - active->crossingBuffTopY];
2947  #endif
2948  }
2949  }
2950  }
2951 
2952  // TODO: bkaskel: Merge the above and below blocks?
2953 
2954  #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
2955  // OPTIMIZATION (can be removed if we always want to compute area acurately for all curved edges)
2956  // The block iterates over all active curve edges and determines whether or not to treat them like
2957  // curves inside this scanline for the purposes of area computation.
2958  if (1)
2959  {
2960  #if defined(PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER) && PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER >= 1
2961  app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type start_time = app_traits::context_type::current_time();
2962  #endif
2963  for ( int edgeCount = 0; edgeCount <= m_highestActiveEdgeIndex; edgeCount++ ) {
2964  edge_type* edge = m_edgeSorts[edgeCount];
2965  if ( edge && !edge->isLine ) {
2966  // test different strategies here
2967  #if defined(ALWAYS_TREAT_CURVES_AS_LINES_LOCALLY)
2968  {
2969  edge->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine = true;
2970  }
2971  #elif defined(NEVER_TREAT_CURVES_AS_LINES_LOCALLY)
2972  {
2973  // do nothing
2974  }
2975  #elif defined(COMPUTE_DISTANCE_OF_CONTROL_POINTS_FROM_LINE)
2976  {
2977  // Measured cost of this section in random curve #3 is ~100 time units
2978  // Measured times for 0.01 tolerance is ~2200 and for 0.03 tolerance is ~2040.
2979 
2980  // If the distances of the local control points of 'edge'
2981  // to the line connecting the local endpoints in the current scanline
2982  // are both less than (4/3)*MAX_ALLOWABLE_DISTANCE then 'edge' will be
2983  // treated as a line for the purposes of area computation.
2984  // The 4/3 factor is a further optimization due to the fact
2985  // that a cubic bezier's distance from the line is never
2986  // more than 3/4 the maximum distance of the control points from the line.
2987  #define MAX_ALLOWABLE_DISTANCE_FLOAT 0.03
2988  #define MAX_ALLOWABLE_DISTANCE_SQUARED_TIMES_16_DIV_9 TETRAPHILIA_STATIC_TYPENAME_REAL(real_type, 16 * MAX_ALLOWABLE_DISTANCE_FLOAT * MAX_ALLOWABLE_DISTANCE_FLOAT / 9)
2989 
2990  real_type xTop = active->curXCross[0];
2991  real_type xBot = active->curXCross[1];
2992  real_type t1 = edge->curTCross[0];
2993  real_type t2 = edge->curTCross[1];
2994 
2995  //real_type A = 1; // = yScanLineEnd - yScanLineStart
2996  real_type B = xTop - xBot;
2997  real_type C = B * yScanLineStart + xTop;
2998  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( AbsVal(xTop + B * yScanLineStart - C) < 0.001 );
2999  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( AbsVal(xBot + B * yScanLineEnd - C) < 0.001 );
3000 
3001  real_type controlPoint1X = ((edge->a_x * t1 + 2 * edge->b_x) * t1 + edge->c_x) * t2 + (edge->b_x * t1 + 2 * edge->c_x) * t1 + edge->d_x;
3002  real_type controlPoint2X = ((edge->a_x * t2 + 2 * edge->b_x) * t2 + edge->c_x) * t1 + (edge->b_x * t2 + 2 * edge->c_x) * t2 + edge->d_x;
3003  real_type controlPoint1Y = ((edge->a_y * t1 + 2 * edge->b_y) * t1 + edge->c_y) * t2 + (edge->b_y * t1 + 2 * edge->c_y) * t1 + edge->d_y;
3004  real_type controlPoint2Y = ((edge->a_y * t2 + 2 * edge->b_y) * t2 + edge->c_y) * t1 + (edge->b_y * t2 + 2 * edge->c_y) * t2 + edge->d_y;
3005 
3006  // distance from point (X,Y) to line x + B y - C = 0 is |X + BY - C| / sqrt(1+B^2)
3007  // so distance squared is (X + BY - C)^2 / (1+B^2)
3008 
3009  real_type D = (1 + B * B) * MAX_ALLOWABLE_DISTANCE_SQUARED_TIMES_16_DIV_9; // 16/9 comes from the 4/3 mentioned in the comment above
3010  real_type N1 = controlPoint1X + B * controlPoint1Y - C;
3011  real_type N2 = controlPoint2X + B * controlPoint2Y - C;
3012  edge->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine = (N1 * N1 < D) && (N2 * N2 < D);
3013  }
3014  #elif defined(USE_PRECOMPUTED_CURVATURE_DATA_1)
3015  {
3016  // Measured cost of this section in random curve #3 is 157 time units
3017  // Measured times for 0.01 tolerance is ~2050 and for 0.03 tolerance is ~2000.
3018  #define MAX_ALLOWABLE_DISTANCE_FLOAT 0.01
3019  #define MAX_ALLOWABLE_DISTANCE TETRAPHILIA_STATIC_TYPENAME_REAL(real_type, MAX_ALLOWABLE_DISTANCE_FLOAT)
3020  #define MAX_ALLOWABLE_DISTANCE_SQUARED_TIMES_64 TETRAPHILIA_STATIC_TYPENAME_REAL(real_type, 64 * MAX_ALLOWABLE_DISTANCE_FLOAT * MAX_ALLOWABLE_DISTANCE_FLOAT)
3021 
3022  real_type t1 = edge->curTCross[0];
3023  real_type t2 = edge->curTCross[1];
3024 
3025  real_type deltaX = active->curXCross[0] - active->curXCross[1];
3026  real_type lineLengthSquared = 1 + deltaX * deltaX;
3027 
3028  real_type n1 = edge->VelocityCrossAcceleration(t1);
3029  n1 *= n1;
3030  real_type n2 = edge->VelocityCrossAcceleration(t2);
3031  n2 *= n2;
3032  real_type xSpeed = edge->xCubicBernsteinPoly.Deriv(t1);
3033  real_type ySpeed = edge->yCubicBernsteinPoly.Deriv(t1);
3034  real_type d1 = xSpeed * xSpeed + ySpeed * ySpeed;
3035  d1 *= d1 * d1;
3036  xSpeed = edge->xCubicBernsteinPoly.Deriv(t2);
3037  ySpeed = edge->yCubicBernsteinPoly.Deriv(t2);
3038  real_type d2 = xSpeed * xSpeed + ySpeed * ySpeed;
3039  d2 *= d2 * d2;
3040 
3041  tetraphilia_assert( n1 >= 0 && n2 >= 0 && d1 >= 0 && d2 >= 0 ); // n's are squares and d's are powers of sums of squares
3042  real_type n, d;
3043  if ( n1 * d2 > n2 * d1 ) {
3044  n = n1;
3045  d = d1;
3046  } else {
3047  n = n2;
3048  d = d2;
3049  }
3050 
3051  // At some point, need to handle this better for FIXED POINT math.
3052 // edge->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine = lineLengthSquared * K_max < (8 * MAX_ALLOWABLE_DISTANCE);
3053  edge->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine = lineLengthSquared * lineLengthSquared * n < d * MAX_ALLOWABLE_DISTANCE_SQUARED_TIMES_64;
3054  }
3055  #elif 1 || defined(USE_PRECOMPUTED_CURVATURE_DATA_2)
3056  {
3057  // Measured cost of this section in random curve #3 is XXX time units
3058  // Measured times for 0.01 tolerance is ~XXX and for 0.03 tolerance is ~XXX.
3059 
3060 
3061  }
3062  #endif
3063  }
3064  }
3065  #if defined(PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER) && PROFILE_BEZIER_REDUCER >= 1
3066  app_traits::context_type::high_precision_time_type end_time = app_traits::context_type::current_time();
3067  m_time_spent_in_probe1 += end_time - start_time - 44;
3068  ++m_num_probe1;
3069  #endif
3070  }
3071  #endif
3072 
3073  // reset segment list
3074  m_lastSegDataBlock = m_firstSegDataBlock;
3075 
3076  // reset intersection record array to contain the two terminators
3077  tetraphilia_assert( m_edge_intersection_buffer[0].m_type == k_terminator );
3078  tetraphilia_assert( m_edge_intersection_buffer[0].m_yVal == limits<real_type>::min() );
3079  tetraphilia_assert( m_numAllocatedIntersectionRecords > 2 && m_edge_intersection_buffer );
3080  m_curEdgeIntersection = &m_edge_intersection_buffer[1];
3081  m_curEdgeIntersectionIndex = 1;
3082  m_curEdgeIntersection->m_type = k_terminator;
3083  m_curEdgeIntersection->m_yVal = limits<real_type>::max();
3084  #ifdef _DEBUG
3085  #ifdef RECORD_INTERSECTION_X_VALUES
3086  *(unsigned long*)&(m_curEdgeIntersection->m_xVal) = 0xcdcdcdcd;
3087  #endif
3088  memset(&m_curEdgeIntersection->m_edge[0], 0xcd, sizeof(m_curEdgeIntersection->m_edge[0]));
3089  memset(&m_curEdgeIntersection->m_edge[1], 0xcd, sizeof(m_curEdgeIntersection->m_edge[1]));
3090  #endif
3091  m_numIntersectionRecords = 2;
3092 
3093  bool processingFirstBandInScanLine = true;
3094 
3095  // 2 stages per scanline, stage=0 for finding intersections inside already defined bands, stage=1 for computing area in bands
3096  for ( int stage = 0; ; ++stage ) { // stage = 0: Intersection prescan for scanline, stage=1: Compute areas for scanline
3097  yBandMin = yScanLineStart;
3098 
3099  // loop through all of the y bands in this scan line
3100  do {
3101 
3102  ReducerYield( 1000 );
3103 
3104  // process any edge changes which occur EXACTLY AT yBandMin (i.e., at the top of the current band)
3105  while ( 1 ) {
3106 
3107  tetraphilia_assert( m_curEdgeInsertionDeletion->m_yVal >= yBandMin );
3108  tetraphilia_assert( m_curEdgeIntersection->m_yVal >= yBandMin );
3109 
3110  // Assert winding numbers are correct
3111  #ifndef NDEBUG
3112  assertWindingNumbersAreCorrect();
3113  #endif
3114 
3115  tetraphilia_assert( m_curEdgeInsertionDeletion->m_yVal != limits<real_type>::min() ); // assert m_curEdgeInsertionDeletion is not the leading terminator since we reference [-1] on it below
3116  if ( m_curEdgeIntersection->m_yVal == yBandMin && (m_curEdgeInsertionDeletion->m_yVal != yBandMin || m_curEdgeIntersection->m_type != k_swapAtTopOfBand) ) {
3117  tetraphilia_assert( stage == 1 );
3118  ProcessNextEdgeIntersectionChange();
3119  }
3120  else if ( m_curEdgeInsertionDeletion->m_yVal == yBandMin )
3121  ProcessNextEdgeInsertionDeletionChange( y );
3122  else
3123  break;
3124  }
3125 
3126  // in stage zero we should always have exhausted all intersection records at this point for this scanline
3127  tetraphilia_assert( stage == 1 || m_curEdgeIntersection->m_yVal == limits<real_type>::max() );
3128 
3129  yBandMax = t4::min<real_type>( m_curEdgeInsertionDeletion->m_yVal, m_curEdgeIntersection->m_yVal );
3130  if ( yBandMax > yScanLineEnd )
3131  yBandMax = yScanLineEnd;
3132 
3133  tetraphilia_assert( yBandMax > yBandMin );
3134 
3135  tetraphilia_assert( m_curEdgeInsertionDeletion->m_yVal >= yBandMax );
3136 
3137 #ifdef SET_X_FROM_INTERSECTIONS
3138  // set band TOP data from any intersection records processed at EXACTLY the top of this band
3139  for (int i = -1; m_curEdgeIntersection[i].m_yVal == yBandMin && (m_curEdgeInsertionDeletion[-1].m_yVal != yBandMin || m_curEdgeIntersection[i].m_type == k_swapAtTopOfBand); --i) {
3140  for (int j = 0; j < 2; ++j) {
3141  edge_type* edge = m_curEdgeIntersection[i].m_edge[j];
3142 
3143  // assert that edge is valid and active
3144  tetraphilia_assert( edge != NULL && edgeIsCurrentlyActive( edge ) );
3145 
3146  if ( !edge->xSetFromIntersection ) { // since we are processing the intersections in reverse order and there are multiple intersections involving the same edge we want to pin to the LAST value
3147 
3148  active->curXBandTop = m_curEdgeIntersection[i].m_xVal;
3149  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x(edge->top()) <= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot <= get_x(edge->bot())) ||
3150  (get_x(edge->top()) >= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot >= get_x(edge->bot())) );
3151 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
3152  edge->curTBandTop = m_curEdgeIntersection[i].m_t[j];
3153  tetraphilia_assert( edge->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine || 0 <= edge->curTBandBot && edge->curTBandBot <= 1 );
3154 #endif
3155  edge->xSetFromIntersection = true;
3156 
3157  // clear local bezier segment cache on edge which might have been using old curX,curT values
3158  edge->curYLocalControlPointsTop = edge->curYLocalControlPointsBot = limits<real_type>::min();
3159  }
3160  }
3161  }
3162 #endif // SET_X_FROM_INTERSECTIONS
3163 
3164  // Set band TOP data on each active edge in this band if necessary.
3165  if ( stage == 0 || yBandMin != yScanLineStart ) {
3166  // don't overwrite top data if recomputeEdgeTopData is true since the data is already been computed and set and the bottom data is unreliable in this case anyway
3167  if ( recomputeEdgeTopData )
3168  recomputeEdgeTopData = false; // clear recomputeEdgeTopData bool
3169  else {
3170  for ( int edgeCount = 0; edgeCount <= m_highestActiveEdgeIndex; edgeCount++ ) {
3171  edge_type* edge = m_edgeSorts[edgeCount];
3172  if ( edge ) {
3173  active_edge_type *active = edge->activeData;
3174 #ifdef SET_X_FROM_INTERSECTIONS
3175  if ( !active->xSetFromIntersection )
3176 #endif
3177  {
3178  active->curXBandTop = active->curXBandBot;
3179 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
3180  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x(edge->top()) <= active->curXBandTop && active->curXBandTop <= get_x(edge->bot())) ||
3181  (get_x(edge->top()) >= active->curXBandTop && active->curXBandTop >= get_x(edge->bot())) );
3182 #endif
3183 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
3184  active->curTBandTop = active->curTBandBot;
3185  tetraphilia_assert( active->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine || 0 <= active->curTBandTop && active->curTBandTop <= 1 );
3186 #endif
3187  }
3188 #ifdef SET_X_FROM_INTERSECTIONS
3189  else
3190  active->xSetFromIntersection = false;
3191 #endif
3192  }
3193  }
3194  }
3195  }
3196  else if ( m_curEdgeInsertionDeletion->m_yVal < yScanLineEnd ) // did we check more than one band during stage 0?
3197  SetEdgeTopDataForTopOfCurrentScanLine(y); // TODO: bkaskel: perhaps better to cache this information on each edge, something like edgeXScanLineTop cached at the start of each scanline in stage 0
3198 
3199  // set band BOTTOM data from any intersection records to be processed at bottom of current band
3200 #ifdef SET_X_FROM_INTERSECTIONS
3201  tetraphilia_assert( m_curEdgeInsertionDeletion->m_yVal >= yBandMax );
3202  for (int i = 0; m_curEdgeIntersection[i].m_yVal == yBandMax && (m_curEdgeInsertionDeletion->m_yVal != yBandMax || m_curEdgeIntersection[i].m_type != k_swapAtTopOfBand); ++i) {
3203  for (int j = 0; j < 2; ++j) {
3204  edge_type* edge = m_curEdgeIntersection[i].m_edge[j];
3205 
3206  // assert that edge is valid and active
3207  tetraphilia_assert( edge != NULL && edgeIsCurrentlyActive(edge) );
3208 
3209  active->curXBandBot = m_curEdgeIntersection[i].m_xVal;
3210 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
3211  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x(edge->top()) <= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot <= get_x(edge->bot())) ||
3212  (get_x(edge->top()) >= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot >= get_x(edge->bot())) );
3213 #endif
3214 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
3215  edge->curTBandBot = m_curEdgeIntersection[i].m_t[j];
3216  tetraphilia_assert( edge->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine || 0 <= edge->curTBandBot && edge->curTBandBot <= 1 );
3217 #endif
3218  edge->xSetFromIntersection = true;
3219 
3220  // clear local bezier segment cache on edge which might have been using old curX,curT values
3221  edge->curYLocalControlPointsTop = edge->curYLocalControlPointsBot = limits<real_type>::min();
3222  }
3223  }
3224 #endif // SET_X_FROM_INTERSECTIONS
3225 
3226  // Set band BOTTOM data on each active edge in this band.
3227  if ( yBandMax == yScanLineEnd ) {
3228  tetraphilia_assert( m_curEdgeIntersection[0].m_yVal == yBandMax || m_curEdgeIntersection[0].m_yVal == limits<real_type>::max() );
3229  for ( int edgeCount = 0; edgeCount <= m_highestActiveEdgeIndex; edgeCount++ ) {
3230  edge_type* edge = m_edgeSorts[edgeCount];
3231  if ( edge ) {
3232  active_edge_type *active = edge->activeData;
3233 #ifdef SET_X_FROM_INTERSECTIONS
3234  if ( !active->xSetFromIntersection )
3235 #endif
3236  {
3237  if ( edge->isLine ) {
3238  tetraphilia_assert( yBandMax > get_y(edge->top()) );
3239 
3240  real_type t = (yBandMax - get_y(edge->top())) * edge->deltaYInverse;
3241  PrecisionGuardian<real_type>::InFixedPointBuildsShiftAsNecessary( t, edge->deltaYInverseShift );
3242  tetraphilia_assert( 0 <= t && t <= real_type(1.001f) ); // not 1 because disivion can introduce significant errors
3243  active->curXBandBot = get_x(edge->top()) + t * edge->deltaX;
3244  // this assert can possible fail in strange cases when t is slightly above 0 or below 1?
3245  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x(edge->top()) <= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot <= real_services::AddAndPin(get_x(edge->bot()), edge->deltaX * real_type(0.001f))) ||
3246  (real_services::AddAndPin(get_x(edge->bot()), edge->deltaX * real_type(0.001f)) <= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot <= get_x(edge->top())) );
3247  }
3248  else {
3249  tetraphilia_assert( active->crossingBuffBotY >= y + 1 );
3250  active->curXBandBot = active->curXCross[1];
3251 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
3252  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x(edge->top()) <= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot <= get_x(edge->bot())) ||
3253  (get_x(edge->top()) >= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot >= get_x(edge->bot())) );
3254 #endif
3255 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
3256  active->curTBandBot = edge->curTCross[1];
3257  tetraphilia_assert( edge->isLine || 0 <= edge->curTBandBot && edge->curTBandBot <= 1 );
3258  tetraphilia_assert( (active->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine && yBandMin != yScanLineStart) || edge->curTBandTop <= edge->curTBandBot );
3259 #endif
3260  }
3261  real_type xDelta = (active->curXBandBot - active->curXBandTop);
3262  real_type tmp = xDelta * edge->deltaXSign;
3263  if ( tmp <= 0 ) { // normally > 0
3264  if ( tmp < 0 || xDelta != 0 ) {
3265  active->curXBandBot = active->curXBandTop;
3266 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
3267  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x(edge->top()) <= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot <= get_x(edge->bot())) ||
3268  (get_x(edge->top()) >= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot >= get_x(edge->bot())) );
3269 #endif
3270 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
3271  tetraphilia_assert( edge->isLine || 0 <= edge->curTBandBot && edge->curTBandBot <= 1 );
3272  tetraphilia_assert( edge->isLine || 0 <= edge->curTBandTop && edge->curTBandTop <= 1 );
3273  //edge->curTBandBot = edge->curTBandTop; // Why do this? Should we instead leave the t value at the bottom as-is?
3274 #endif
3275  }
3276  }
3277  }
3278 #ifdef SET_X_FROM_INTERSECTIONS
3279  else
3280  edge->xSetFromIntersection = false;
3281 #endif
3282  }
3283  }
3284  }
3285  else {
3286  for ( int edgeCount = 0; edgeCount <= m_highestActiveEdgeIndex; edgeCount++ ) {
3287  edge_type* edge = m_edgeSorts[edgeCount];
3288  if ( edge ) {
3289  active_edge_type *active = edge->activeData;
3290 #ifdef SET_X_FROM_INTERSECTIONS
3291  if ( !edge->xSetFromIntersection )
3292 #endif
3293  {
3294  if ( edge->isLine )
3295  {
3296  tetraphilia_assert( yBandMax > get_y(edge->top()) );
3297  real_type t = (yBandMax - get_y(edge->top())) * edge->deltaYInverse;
3298  PrecisionGuardian<real_type>::InFixedPointBuildsShiftAsNecessary( t, edge->deltaYInverseShift );
3299  tetraphilia_assert( 0 <= t && t <= real_type(1.001f) ); // not 1 because disivion can introduce significant errors
3300  active->curXBandBot = get_x(edge->top()) + t * edge->deltaX;
3301  // this assert can possible fail in strange cases when t is slightly above 0 or below 1?
3302  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x(edge->top()) <= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot <= real_services::AddAndPin(get_x(edge->bot()), edge->deltaX * real_type(0.001f))) ||
3303  (real_services::AddAndPin(get_x(edge->bot()), edge->deltaX * real_type(0.001f)) <= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot <= get_x(edge->top())) );
3304  }
3305  else {
3306 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
3307  if ( active->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine )
3308 #endif
3309  {
3310  tetraphilia_assert( yBandMax > get_y(edge->top()) );
3311  active->curXBandBot = (yBandMax == get_y(edge->bot())) ? get_x(edge->bot())
3312  : (get_y(edge->bot()) >= yScanLineEnd) ? active->curXBandTop + (active->curXCross[1] - active->curXBandTop) * ((yBandMax - yBandMin) / (yScanLineEnd - yBandMin))// TODO: bkaskel: compute reciprocal of (yScanLineEnd - yBandMin) once and store it instead here
3313  : active->curXBandTop + (get_x(edge->bot()) - active->curXBandTop) * ((yBandMax - yBandMin) / (get_y(edge->bot()) - yBandMin));
3314 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
3315  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x(edge->top()) <= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot <= get_x(edge->bot())) ||
3316  (get_x(edge->top()) >= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot >= get_x(edge->bot())) );
3317 #endif
3318  }
3319 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
3320  else {
3321  getXAndTValuesForYValue( edge, yBandMax, active->curXBandBot, edge->curTBandBot );
3322  real_type t_tmp;
3323  getXAndTValuesForYValue( edge, yBandMax, active->curXBandBot, t_tmp );
3324  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x(edge->top()) <= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot <= get_x(edge->bot())) ||
3325  (get_x(edge->top()) >= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot >= get_x(edge->bot())) );
3326  }
3327 #endif
3328  }
3329  }
3330 #ifdef SET_X_FROM_INTERSECTIONS
3331  else
3332  active->xSetFromIntersection = false;
3333 #endif
3334 
3335 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
3336  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( yBandMax - yBandMin < 0.017 || edge->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine || edge->curTBandTop != edge->curTBandBot ); // 0.001 seems to suffice for floating point builds.
3337 #endif
3338 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
3339  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( (get_x(edge->top()) - Epsilon(AbsVal(get_x(edge->top()))) <= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot <= get_x(edge->bot()) + Epsilon(AbsVal(get_x(edge->bot())))) ||
3340  (get_x(edge->top()) + Epsilon(AbsVal(get_x(edge->top()))) >= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot >= get_x(edge->bot()) - Epsilon(AbsVal(get_x(edge->bot())))) );
3341 #endif
3342  real_type xDelta = (active->curXBandBot - active->curXBandTop);
3343  real_type tmp = xDelta * edge->deltaXSign;
3344  if ( tmp <= 0 ) { // usually > 0
3345  if ( tmp < 0 || xDelta != 0 ) {
3346  active->curXBandBot = active->curXBandTop;
3347 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_CROSSINGS
3348  tetraphilia_assert( (get_x(edge->top()) <= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot <= get_x(edge->bot())) ||
3349  (get_x(edge->top()) >= active->curXBandBot && active->curXBandBot >= get_x(edge->bot())) );
3350 #endif
3351  }
3352  }
3353 #ifdef COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS
3354  if ( !edge->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine && edge->curTBandBot < edge->curTBandTop ) {
3355  edge->curTBandBot = edge->curTBandTop;
3356  tetraphilia_assert( 0 <= edge->curTBandBot && edge->curTBandBot <= 1 );
3357  }
3358 #endif
3359  }
3360  }
3361  }
3362 
3363  // Assert top and bottom t values for curved edges are distinct.
3364  // This need not strictly be true since if there is a very very narrow band,
3365  // it is conceivable that the top and bottom t (and x) values could be the same.
3366  // However I am currently seeing many bugs where the t values are incorrectly identical,
3367  // so for now we will assert that the values are distinct. Once this code all stabilizes,
3368  // this assert can be safely removed if it causes any problems. --bkaskel 5/11/05
3369  #if defined(TETRAPHILIA_SUPPORT_REDUCER_PRECISION_ASSERT) && defined(COMPUTE_PRECISE_AREAS)
3370  if ( yBandMax - yBandMin > 0.021 ) // added this if later to avoid very very tiny bands // 0.005 seemed to suffice for floating point builds
3371  {
3372  for ( int edgeCount = 0; edgeCount <= m_highestActiveEdgeIndex; edgeCount++ ) {
3373  edge_type* edge = m_edgeSorts[edgeCount];
3374  if ( edge && !edge->isConsideredLineForCurrentScanLine )
3375  tetraphilia_reducer_precision_assert( edge->curTBandTop != edge->curTBandBot );
3376  }
3377  }
3378  #endif
3379 
3380  // Assert intra-band top and bottom x values are moving in the correct direction for each edge.
3381  #ifndef NDEBUG
3382  {
3383  for ( int edgeCount = 0; edgeCount <= m_highestActiveEdgeIndex; edgeCount++ ) {
3384  edge_type* edge = m_edgeSorts[edgeCount];
3385  if ( edge ) {
3386  active_edge_type *active = edge->activeData;
3387  if ( edge->deltaXSign > 0 )
